Judith is 30 years old, married, and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has two children: a 14-year-old boy and a 7-year-old girl. She currently keeps her merchandise in her home, although she sometimes makes sales calls. She will use the loan to buy clothing, shoes and electric appliances to increase her sales and thereby establish a shop in her home. Judith’s dream is to be able to finish building her house and thereby give her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Judith del Carmen tiene 8 años de ser una comerciante. Empezó vendiendo ropa hace 8 años, actividad que inició con esfuerzo y capital propio, con el tiempo logró también incursionar en la venta de electrodomésticos. Judith tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino. Tiene 2 hijos, un varon de 14 años de edad y una niña de 7 años de edad. Actualmente la mercadería la tiene en su casa de habitación, aunque otras veces las ventas las hace ambulante. El préstamo lo usará para comprar ropa, zapatos y electrodomésticos para reforzar sus ventas y así llegar a poner una tienda en su casa de habitación. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación, y así darles mejor vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances, clothing, shoes to increase sales

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H. is 36 years old. She has three children, all of them are at school age. Before joining TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam), she didn't have much funds to do business. Thus, she was just a small retailer in her village's market. In 2000, she joined TYM Fund to borrow money and expand her business. Everyday, her husband buyes vegetable and other kinds of food, so that Mrs. H. can sell them to the villagers. Her customers include not just villagers but also other workers from the industrial area of Noibai, who have come and rent houses around this area. In 2004, Mrs. H. saw a new demand. She opened a breakfast restaurant, while still selling fruit. Her business has grown since. She is now able to buy other furniture in the house and provide her children with a good education. This time Mrs. H. would like to borrow 19,000,000 VND (approximately 1150 USD) to buy more fruit and food, in order to provide better service to her customers. On average, her family income is 6,000,000 VND (i.e., 375 USD) per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hưng năm nay 36 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vì chưa có nhiều vốn nên chị chỉ buôn bán lặt vặt nhỏ lẻ tại chợ thôn. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào kinh doanh tại chợ. Hàng ngày chồng chị sử dụng vốn để đi mua rau và các loại thực phẩm khác từ đại lý về để chị bán lẻ cho người dân tại địa phương. Ngoài những người dân địa phương chị còn có thêm nguồn khách hàng rất lớn là những người công nhân của khu công nghiệp Nội Bài đến thuê nhà trọ tại khu vực gia đình chị sinh sống. Năm 2004, do nắm bắt được nhu cầu của người dân địa phương gia đình chị chuyển sang bán hàng ăn sáng và buôn bán hoa quả, thu nhập ngày càng khá hơn nên chị đã có điều kiện mua sắm thêm trang thiết bị trong gia đình và đầu tư cho con cái ăn học. Vòng vốn này chị mong muốn được vay thêm 19.000.000 đ để đầu tư vốn mua thực phẩm và hoa quả để phục vụ tốt hơn nhu cầu của khách hàng. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi tháng của gia đình chị là 6.000.000 đồng

loans.use: Buy food and fruits

loans.name: Thi Sen's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chị Đặng thị Sen is 30 years old. Her family cooks vegetarian food. Her group already had one 6-month lending cycle, which has already been paid back very well. This time, she wants to borrow 2.478.000 VND to buy statues for sell.

In her group, there are also:

  • Mrs. Nguyễn thị Hồng, borrowing 2.478.000 VND to cook vegetarian food.
  • Mrs. Đặng thị Thúy, borrowing 2.006.000 VND to buy cast iron to make pots
  • Mrs. Mẫn thị Lượng, borrowing 2.478.000 VND to buy cooking supplies for Vietnamese desserts
  • Mrs. Nguyễn thị Tất, borrowing 2.478.000 VND to cook vegetarian food

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

    Chị Đặng thị Sen năm nay 30 tuổi.Gia đình chị làm đồ chay.Chị cùng nhóm đã được một chu kỳ vay 6 thang và đã hoàn trả vốn vay rất tốt . Đợt này chị vay 2.478.000 VND về mua đồ tượng để làm hàng.

    Trong nhóm chị có:

  • Chị Nguyễn thị Hồng vay 2.478.000 VND để làm đồ chay.
  • Chị Đặng thị Thúy vay ở mức 2.006.000 VND để mua gang về đúc nồi
  • Chị Mẫn thị Lượng vay 2.478.000 VND mua đồ nấu chè
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Tất vay mức 2.478.000 VND để làm đồ chay

loans.use: Cooking and pot casting

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Mrs. Khiev S. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Toy, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. These family members have only two business activities which can make only a small income and cannot improve their lives.

In order to improve Mrs. Khiev S.'s family's living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. Mrs. Khiev S. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business

loans.name: Kazija

texts.en:
Kazija is 45 years old, and she is married with 5 children. She has been a firewood and small fish seller since 2004. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Kazija has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Kazija is now looking for a loan to buy firewood and small fish for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and small fish for re-sale

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mr. Khem K. is 56 years old and rents musical instruments for ceremonies such as wedding parties and other happy occasions. He has been running his business since 1999 and earns currently around $4 per day. His wife, Mrs. Khlor Phalla, 47, is a grocery seller and sells many kinds of products such as oils, cake, soap, and porridge, and so forth. They have five children, two of whom are married and the other three are single and live at home. The family lives in Prey Kuy Commune, Kampong Thom Province. To support his business, Khem is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase more modern musical instruments for his business and to buy more groceries for his wife to sell. Mr. Khem's wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To buy musical instruments and groceries

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua  que se llama 380, tiene 53 años de edad,  su esposa tiene  dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, que están estudiando, su esposa vende verdura ambulante para ayudar a los gastos de su familia, don Eduardo trabaja como bombero desde hade seis años, lo cual inicio como conductor en los bomberos con esta solicitud es la séptima lo cual quiere comprar materiales para construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa para tener mas seguridad para su familia. A largo plazo es seguir prestando en Afodenic para seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa, a si como seguir prestando el servicio a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo V. lives in a neighborhood in the capital city of Managua called 380. He is 53 years old. His wife has 2 children, ages 15 and 17, who are still in school. His wife sells vegetables as a street vendor in order to help with the family expenses. Mr. V. has been working as a firefighter for six years. He started out as a fire truck driver for the fire department. This is his seventh loan request, with which he would like to purchase materials to build a protective wall in front of his house in order for his family to be safer. In the long run, he wishes to keep borrowing from Afodenic for home improvement, as well as keep providing services to society.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a protective wall

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: El grupo "Amigas por Siempre" se encuentra en su segundo ciclo representados por la señora Edith Julia han demostrado responsabilidad y cumplimiento en su anterior ciclo teniendo experiencia en grupos solidarios. En general los socios (as) se dedican a la venta de electrodomésticos, ropa, zapatillas deportivas, mochilas, comestibles, peluches y los varones a la prestación de servicios y al transporte público. Los socios (as) saben que el mercado es amplio y que la competencia es grande pero los años de experiencia les han demostrado que cuando se tiene dedicación y constancia al negocio siempre se sale adelante. El destino del financiamiento otorgado por la fundación Agrocapital es para la compra de productos e insumos para estocar sus comercios con material de buena calidad y para la reparación de sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
The group Amigas por Siempre (Friends Forever) is in their second loan cycle and are represented by Mrs. Edith Julia; they have demonstrated responsibility and accomplishment in their previous cycle as they have had experience with support groups before. In general, the members work selling appliances, clothing, athletic shoes, backpacks, food, and toys and the men work in service or public transport businesses. The group members know that the market is large and there is a lot of competition, but years of experience have taught them that dedication and consistency help businesses to continue to grow. The loan from the Agrocapital Foundation will help them purchase products and ingredients to stock their businesses with high quality materials and to repair their tools.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of four members, and they are asking for a loan from Kiva.  Mrs. S., 46, sells noodle soup and porridge in the her local market in Battambang Province.  She has been selling since 2005 and can earn around $4 per day.  She is married to Von, 48; he is a doctor for the army.  Her business is going well because it is located near a crowded market.  She cares for four children, all of whom are young.  In addition to her soup and porridge business, S. buys watermelon fruit stocks from growers and wholesales to her customers for profit.  Now is the time for this business, but she lacks capital to do it.  Therefore, she needs a loan to carry out her business activities.  

The other three members will use the loan in specific ways.  Mrs. Y. N. is widowed and sells soy-bean juice.  She needs a loan to expand her business by purchasing ingredients to make soy-bean juices.  Mrs. S., 28, is food seller and needs a loan to purchase ingredients to make food.  Mrs. R., 60, is grocery seller and needs a loan to buy more groceries.

loans.use: Buy watermelon fruit stocks

loans.name: Diego Fidel

texts.es: Don Diego Fidel T. Menchù con 24 años de edad, es casado, de oficios Albañil habita junto a su hijos, y su esposa en el Caserío Paximabaj de la Aldea Nimasac, departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente Presta sus servicios de albañil en las comunidades de Totonicapán, pero debido a que  el salario es mínimo y no cubre sus necesidades básicas acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de empezar su negocio propio y con ello mejorar sus condiciones de vida y  la de su familia y así poder salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Don Diego Fidel T. Menchù is 24, married and works as a mason. He lives with his wife and children in Caserio Paximabaj at Aldea Nimasac, Totonicapán, Guatemala. He currently works in the villages of Totonicapán but the wage is minimal and does not cover his basic needs. As a result, he contacted Asociación ASDIR so as to get a loan to start his own business, improve his family living and have a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Working Capital)

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike O. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells rechargeable phone cards and rents Video CD’s. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
K. Marie est née vers 1966  à Guévié Zoukomè dans le 1er Arrondissement de la ville de Porto- Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Marie est Mariée et a un (1) enfant. Marie est une vendeuse de divers (tomates en boite,sardine,mousquito,etc.); mais faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner à temps, Marie n'arrive pas à bien satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Pour renforcer son activité Marie sollicite un prêt.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Marie K. was born around 1966 in Guévié Zoukomè in the First District of the city of Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Marie is married and has one child. She is a petty trader selling various items (tinned tomatoes, sardines, mosquito coils, etc.) but since she lacks sufficient capital, she is not able to restock her stall in a timely manner and thus does not manage to satisfy the needs of her clientele. To bolster her little business, she is asking for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing tinned tomatoes, sardines, milk, pasta, mosquito coils,etc.  for re-sale

loans.name: Faasega

texts.en: Faasega T., 49, is married with children. She has five years of experience in the taro-taamu plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public five days per week. Faasega has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 tala ($64 USD). SPBD loans are Faasega’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase knives, fertilizers, chemicals, timber, and cement

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
“A man of perseverance will somehow reach the top,” said Danny B., a hard-working farmer who lives in the rural community of Bangar Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife, Adelena, is a market vendor in Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have three children studying in the tertiary and secondary levels of education. Sending them to school is very costly. That is why Danny works hard to support their financial needs.

Danny visits their farmland almost every day. He plants rice and fruit trees. Every harvest, he is able to produce 60 cavans of rice -- half of it is being sold for them to have an income while the other half is being stored for family consumption. Danny wants to borrow PHP23,000 to purchase agricultural supplies to maintain their farming business. He believes that through the loan, he can increase his production and income.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Julia Lilly

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Julia P. se dedica a laborar en la venta de muebles de madera como lo son mesas, sillas, pequeños roperos y algunos productos metálicos.

El negocio hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de hacer pronta inversión para su respectivo desarrollo y para ello espera fielmente en que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para la compra de dichos productos de madera de sus proveedores y así suplir su establecimiento y mejorar su condición económica actual.
texts.en:
In the central market of the city of Cinandega, Mrs. Julia Perez works in the sale of wooden furniture such as tables, chairs, small wardrobes, and some metallic products.

Today the business is in need of a quick investment for its development, and due to this she faithfully hopes that Ceprodel will provide a loan for the purchase of the aforementioned wooden products from her suppliers and to thereby supply her establishment and to improve her current financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wooden furniture

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Mr. Ignacio B. is 27 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá.  

From age 14 he has worked as a street vendor, selling bedspreads that his mother makes.  After six years, he became independent and started to work for himself.  He takes his handicrafts from his district to cell them in the cities Villa Elisa and Asunción.  Ignacio transports them in his truck, which he was able to buy after saving his profits.  In this way he also helps his mother, who is dependent on him.  

He applied for this loan in order to have more capital to invest in the goods he sells, such as hammocks and bedspreads.
texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio B. is 27 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. From age 14 he has worked as a street vendor, selling bedspreads that his mother makes. After six years, he became independent and started to work for himself. He takes his handicrafts from his district to sell them in the cities or Villa Elisa and Asunción. Ignacio transports them in his truck, which he was able to buy after saving his profits. In this way he also helps his mother, who is depends on him financially. He applied for this loan in order to have more capital to invest in the goods he sells, such as hammocks and bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods to sell such as hammocks and bedspreads.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina G. is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew on a tabletop by the roadside in the afternoons. She has been in business for seven years. Angelina wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi.

Angelina is 38 years old, divorced and has two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her two children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her goal is to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. EUFRACIO, es natural del distrito de Patria en kosñipata, ubicado en el departamento de Cusco, es aquí dónde empieza la entrada a la amazonía peruana, tenemos al majestuoso parque natural del Manu.

El socio es conviviente de la socia Elsa Martinez, y el se dedica a la construcción, y al cultivo de tierras, el trabaja personalmente las tierras en el sembrío de yuca, arroz, plátanos y coca, dependiendo la época el alterna su producción. El socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de semillas para su nueva producción y comprar algunas herramientas.

El socio agradece y del mismo modo valora el esfuerzo y respaldo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Senor Eufracio is from the district of Patria in Konispata, located in the department of Cusco. It is here, where the entrance to the Peruvian Amazon begins, that we have the majestic natural park of Manu.

Eufracio lives with Elsa Martinez and engages in construction and farming. He personally works the land, planting yucca, rice, bananas and coca, varying his production depending on the season. Eufracio is requesting a loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of seeds for his new crops and to buy some tools.

He is thankful and values the effort and support offered by means of this loan and is committed to making payments on his debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and tools

loans.name: Fátima Yesenia

texts.es: Fátima Yesenia C. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. A sus cortos 20 años de edad Fátima ya es madre de dos niños Alex de 6 años y Mario de 6 meses. Fátima vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos hace ya seis años, en su mayoría sus  compradores son clientes individuales y también por comerciantes ya que Fátima cuenta con bajos precios y un producto muy fresco, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el muelle del puerto de La Libertad una zona con mucha afluencia nacional y extranjera, el crédito que solicita Fátima es para aumentar su inventario para poder percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Fátima Yesenia C. lives in the department of La Libertad. At her young age of 20, Fátima is already the mother of 2 children, Alex, who is 6 years old, and Mario, who is 6 months old. Fátima lives with her husband and children. She has sold seafood for 6 years. For the most part, her customers are individual clients and she also serves merchants, since she has low prices and fresh products. Her business is located on the dock in La Libertad, which is an area with a lot of domestic and foreign abundance. The loan that Fátima is requesting will be used to increase her inventory so that she can have larger earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: materia prima para pupusas

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, ella tiene 75 años de edad, es viuda  y tiene 9 hijos mayores de edad con quienes comparte el trabajo, pues ella se dedica a la crianza de aves, como pollos, patos, pavos, también tiene cinco parcelas de sembríos de yuca. Juanita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Guadalupe”, es una socia muy puntual  en sus pagos, empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles y lo invirtió en el mantenimiento de su galpón. 
Con este préstamo de 1500 soles, comprará alimentos balanceados para sus aves y también comprará patos y pollitos para colocarlos en su granja. Su meta es aumentar un galpón para la crianza de las aves  y de esta manera contribuir con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: comprará alimentos balanceados.  Compra de animales menores (patos y pollitos) para aumentar su granja

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
LIZ ABIGAIL E. F., a quien ubicamos en la fotografía sentada cargando a uno D. sus hijitos. Tiene 25años D. edad, convive con su pareja y tienen dos pequeños hijos. Ella integra el Grupo “Siempre Adelante” junto a 8 personas muy trabajadoras que residen en el distrito D. Comas.

La Sra. Abigail, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, los cuales ofrece a sus familiares y amigos visitándolos en sus domicilios. Nos comenta que le agrada mucho éste trabajo, porque pueD. conocer gente, ver a menudo a sus amigas y familia y sobre todo porque le da tiempo para atender y compartir momentos con sus hijos.

Gracias a su trabajo, ella pueD. ser el apoyo D. su pareja cuando se queda sin trabajo, ya que, no cuenta con empleo estable; además pueD. cubrir gastos D. sus pequeños hijos, como ropa, profesores particulares y paseos.

Le gustaría mucho trasladar a su hijo D. 8 años, a un colegio particular, lo cual tiene planeado para el próximo año.

Con el préstamo solicitado, invertirá en la compra D. calzado, para lo cual utilizará el mismo sistema D. venta que los productos D. belleza.
texts.en:
Liz Abigail E. F. is the one sitting in the picture holding her child. She is 25 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has two small children. She is part of the group “Siempre Adelante” along with 8 other people who are all hard workers who live in the Comas district. Mrs. Abigail sells beauty products to her family and friends for a living. She goes to their homes to make her sales and tells us that she enjoys this work a lot because she gets to meet people, see her friends and family often, and above all because it gives her time to both take care of her children and to spend time them. Thanks to her job, she can support her husband when he’s without work since he doesn’t have stable employment. She is also able to take care of her children’s expenses like clothing, private teachers, and outings. She would like to be able to move her eight year old to a private school (which she plans on doing next year). With this loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of shoes that she will sell in the same way she sells beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new line of business

loans.name: Giovanny

texts.es: Danilo G. A., tiene 44 años de edad, casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar mas ganado para carne. Hace muchos años que se dedica al campo y la ganaderia y quiere crecer. Es el segundo prestamo que ha recibido de Fudecosur. El manifiesta que no tenia problemas en el campo hace muchos años, pero desea crecer, por tal razón decide realizar el prestamo y ver la posibilidad de crecer. Además, él desea brindar a sus hijos un futuro mejor y estable y ayudarle en el dia final. El tambien cultiva cafe pero piensa que un campo diverso es mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Danilo G. A. is 44 years old, married and has two children who are his first priority. He wants to buy more livestock for butchering. He has spent many years working in the fields and with livestock and he wants to grow his business. This is the second loan from Fudecosur. He asserts that he has not had problems with his fields for many years but wants to grow and to be able to see that possibility become reality decided to get this loan. Also, he wants to provide a better and more stable future for his children and help them as long as he can. He also grows coffee but believes that a more diverse farm is better for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia María S. quiere empezar la construcción para su vivienda ya que vive porque sus hijos ya tienen su propia familia  y desea tener su propia casa.
Solicita el préstamo, porque en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para empezar la construcción de su casa  y así ella dejara de pagar renta ya que es muy alto el costo que esta pagando. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabaja como enfermera de una persona ya mayor de edad.
texts.en:
Ofelia María S. wants to start building her house. Her children have their own families. She wishes to have her own house. She is asking for the loan because she does not have the money that is necessary to start construction on her house. When she has her own house she will stop paying rent, which is very high. She plans to repay the loan with her income from working as a nurse for an elderly person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start building her house

loans.name: Felicitas Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” del distrito de Azángaro de la Región Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y estudió hasta el 5to año de secundaria.
Felicitas Emiliana viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue S/. 300.00 (nuevos soles) el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado vacuno.
En la actualidad requiere de un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 (nuevos soles), el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno mejorado. Paralelamente la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de abarrotes, para ello comprará arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite, etc. 
Su mayor deseo es progresar, ser mayorista, además contar con ganado vacuno mejorado. 
Referente a su Banco Comunal, ella manifiesta que le gustan los ahorros y utilidades producto del ahorro.
texts.en:
Felicitas Emiliana is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” cooperative bank in the Azángaro district of the Puno region. She is 40 years old, married, has 3 children, and she studied until the 5th year of secondary school. Felicitas Emiliana has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling cattle. Presently, she needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy better livestock. Concurrently, this member dedicates herself to selling groceries, and for this will buy rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. Her greatest wish is to make progress, become a wholesaler, and also to have high-quality livestock. With regard to her cooperative bank, she notes that she likes to save and the benefits of having a savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock, as well as groceries such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida R. manages her “ balut” (chicken embryo vending business) in the village of Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. She is married to Eduardo R., and having six children to support. All of her children are presently enrolled in a public school in their village. Being a supportive mother, she needs to work hard in order to sustain their family needs especially in providing the daily allowances and tuition fees of their children.

From her experiences, she knows that sending her children in school is difficult if she doesn’t have an extra source of income. For over three years, she has been engaged in selling balut and she earns an income of PHP 1,000 a week. This business helps her provide her children’s tuition payments during their examinations. When she needs financial assistance, she goes house to house to sell balut in order to sustain the needs of her family.

At present she has insufficient funds for maintaining her vending business. She is now asking from the KIVA lenders the loan amount of 7,000 PHP to buy more items to sell and to run her business to become productive and also to uplift their living condition.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace G. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Grace is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 17,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ndiome

texts.en: Mr. Ndiome T. buys and sells goats in Bambey, a rural community situated half way between Dakar and the sacred town of Touba.  He began this activity five years ago to supplement his income from farming.  With the loan of 200,000 FCFA he would like to diversify a bit and buy a steer to raise.  This is Mr. T.'s first loan from UIMCEC.

loans.use: Buying a steer

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mrs. Torn K. is 37 years old and lives in Angk Ta Phouk village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.8 hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Try Parng, is a duck breeder. In order to find an easier way to sell duck eggs door-to-door from home, Mrs. Torn K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike. She will use the rest of the loan to support her field. 

Mrs. Torn K. is the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Yliane

texts.es:
Yliane es soltera, tiene 42 años de edad y vive junto a su madre y hermana en el distrito de Nueva Arica, ubicado a dos horas y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace más de 20 años, cría cabras para venderlas a los negociantes que visitan la zona constantemente. Este negocio es la fuente más importante de ingreso económico de su hogar por lo que da todo de si para mantenerlo y sacarlo adelante.

Yliane distribuye su tiempo entre el cuidado de los animales que cría y el ayudar a su hermana en el cuidado de los niños que llegan a su casa. Su vivienda funciona como wawa – wasi (guardería de niños ubicada en zonas rurales del país) y todas las tardes ella, su hermana y su madre, les brindan el mejor cuidado y les enseñan con juegos y dinámicas.

Yiliane desea mejorar el ambiente de su vivienda que funciona como wawa-wasi, ya que no tienen piso y el contacto con la tierra puede ser un foco infeccioso para los niños. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en hacer las mejoras necesarias para hacer del wawa-wasi un lugar más seguro.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy entregada a sus labores. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yliana is 42 years old, single, and lives with her mother and sister in the District of Nueva Arica, which is located two hours and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Yliana has been raising animals for more than twenty years. She sells goats to merchants who constantly pass through the area. Her business is the most important source of household income because it provides everything she needs to support her family and move forward.

Yliana divides her time between caring for her animals and helping her sister manage a day care center in their home. Every afternoon, she assists her sister and her mother with providing the best care for the children and engaging them in games and other activities.

Yliana wants to make improvements to her home since it also functions as a day care center. There is no flooring in her house and direct contact with the ground can be a source of infection for the children. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles in order to make the necessary improvements that will make the day care center a safer place.

Yliana is hardworking, honest, and fully engaged in all of her business activities. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to the day care center in her home

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Phorn Eng Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes nine people who live in Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chan Phorn E. is the village bank president. She was selected by the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Nang Vat, are farmers who own one hectare of land to grow rice to support their family.  They have a problem because their rice field has a lot of insects and they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Chan Phorn E. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticide. She is the mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local public school, while the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy pesticide

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz S. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Paz is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Paz owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Paz has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Paz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Paz is requesting a new loan of 7,545 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Paz from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca G. is from the village of Minaog. She is 56 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Rebecca owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling barbecue in the local community (the photo shows Rebecca with a customer). Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to used to purchase pigs for lechon (Philippine-style roasted pig) to sell in the community. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita Q. is a 55 year-old woman living in the town of Bulanon, Brgy. Rafaela Barerra.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a sari sari store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in this business for over 32 years and earns approximately PHP10000 a month from these activities.

In 2001, Nenita joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP29500  from NWTF. Nenita is now requesting a new loan of PHP29500, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 20th loan taken out by Nenita from NWTF. Nenita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buen Pastor está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras que en el tiempo que tienen de trabajar con Adim se han desarrollado tanto como microempresarias que son como en sus conocimiento según mencionaron. Esto es debido a que ahora cuentan con una mejor comunicación, administración y otros conocimientos que le ayudan en su trabajo y hogar.
 Una de ella es la señora María Felix M. quien en 1990 inicio a comercializar unas cuantas frutas y verduras en el Mercado de Masaya. En este tiempo y con su esfuerzo y el de sus hijos de 18 y 13 años, quienes le ayudan en el negocio, ha mejorado considerablemente según comento ahora trabaja con mayor inversión, más desahogada y puede adquirir cosechas más grandes.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Sabina P. desde hace 25 años vende frutas y tamales (comida típica nicaragüense a base de maíz nesquisado y se envuelve en hojas de chaquite) y Ana María Ruiz vende cosméticos de la marca Avon y Ropa.
texts.en:
The Buen Pastor (Good Shepherd) group is made up of three hard-working people who have developed as micro entrepreneurs and in their general knowledge while associated with Adim because they have improved communication, management and other skills that help them both at work and at home. One of them is María Felix M. who started out in 1990 selling a few fruits and vegetables in Masaya’s market. Now, through her own efforts and with help from her 18- and 13-year-old sons who help her with the business, she has improved considerably; she now has a larger investment, she is less strapped and can acquire larger crops. Her fellow group members are: Sabina P. who has sold fruit and tamales (typical Nicaraguan dish made from hulled cornmeal wrapped in banana leaves) for the last 25 years and Ana María Ruiz who sells Avon products and clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal crops.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
H. is 41 years old and a married man. His wife, who appears in the photo, is a local cultivator. This couple have five children all of whom attend the public local school. H. is currently able to generate a great income by selling chopped wood. He first purchases firewood at a reasonable price from people who live near the forest, then he sells the wood at retail prices thus gaining a profit.

Typically, H. hires his neighbor’s animal to transport the firewood to be sold. To help reduce his costs, he is applying for a loan to purchase a pair of oxen which he will use to pick up and deliver the chopped wood.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of oxen to pick up and deliver firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase grocery products

loans.name: Policarpo

texts.es:
Policarpo, tiene 42 años, es soltero  y es natural del Cusco. Actualmente, Su actividad principal es administrar su salón de belleza llamado “Centro de Estética Juan Carlos” que está ubicado en la calle Pavitos muy cerca a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad del Cusco. El es una persona emprendedora y motivado por sus familiares y amigos decidió abrir un salón de belleza en el cusco. Policarpio requiere el préstamo para comprar tintes, champús y líquidos de permanentes.  

Policarpio pertenece al banco comunal “Chaska Ñahui” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son tres ciclos que participa y se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro, capacitación y  también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Policarpio manifiesta porque permanece en el banco comunal: “Nos hacen un préstamo rápido para invertir en nuestro negocio”.
texts.en:
Policarpio is 42 years old, single, and is from Cusco. Currently, his primary business is running his beauty salon, which is called “Centro de Estética Juan Carlos”, which is located in the street Calle Pavitos, very close to Plaza de Armas in the city of Cusco. He is an enterprising person and, motivated by his family and friends, decided to open a beauty salon in Cusco. Policarpio requests the loan in order to buy dyes, shampoos, and perm supplies. Policarpio belongs to the community bank “Chaska Ñahui" of the Araiwa association. He has already participated in three loan cycles, and he is content and satisfied with the credit, loan, and training services and and is grateful for the opportunity offered to him in this way and promises to complete the repayments according to the schedule. Policarpio explains why he is with the community bank this way: "They gives us quick loans in order to invest in our businesses."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Policarpio requests the loan to buy dyes, shampoo, and perm supplies.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
In the current world today, everybody ought to be very hardworking to make ends meet for a better living. That’s what Harriet, a mother of three, says as she grinds groundnuts (peanuts) for her clients in Masindi, Uganda. Her husband is also a businessman.

Harriet sells groundnuts, beans, and also has a grinding machine for groundnuts, a business which has a market because people are relying on the grinders rather than pounding groundnuts themselves manually. She has been in the business for six years and still hopes to add more grinding machines for increased income.

Having started with only a grinding machine, Harriet now offers a stock of groundnuts for sale. This is Harriet’s third loan from HOFOKAM and she intends to purchase more groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Galuth Ernestina

texts.es:
Galuth Ernestina R. F. tiene 32 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 1 hijo, Wilson (15). 

Galuth  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Galuth se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño incrementa la producción la tener mayores ingresos. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta la agricultura y celebrar las fiestas de la localidad.
texts.en:
Galuth Ernestina R. F. is 32 years old. She is single and lives in the parish of Estero Salado in the Ecuadorean canton of Chillanes. She has one son, Wilson, 15. Galuth is a member of the Fronteras Unidas rural outreach program in Estero Salado, some two hours from the agency office in the town of Chillanes. The group has 19 members. Many of the people in the area make a living from farming. Galuth is among those whose livelihood depends on farming. She grows cacao. She buys and sells in Matilde Esther. Galuth is applying for a loan to buy cacao seeds so that she can grow her business. She knows the loan is a chance for her to improve her standard of living and she expects to increase her production and, in turn, her income. Galuth enjoys farming and local festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz, es cliente antigua se dedica al oficio D. la panaderia y reposteria más D. veinte años, ella vive en la zona sur y realiza trabajos D. reposteria como empanadas, pasteles, queques, tortas, que lleva a las pastelerias y snacks D. la zona central, ella vive con sus dos hijos, quienes ya son profesionales, y constantemente viajan, ella juntamente con su hermana se dedican a esta actividad, la Sra. quedo viuda hace 15 años y se dedico a trabajar en la reposteria, con dicha actividad saco adelante a sus hijos, ahora como cliente nuestra es nuy responsable en sus pagos, y este prestamo lo destinará a la compra D. harina y otros materiales e insumos que necesita para su actividad, al margen tambien reparte víveres a credito y va cobrando cada mes o semanalmente segun D. como acomoda los productos, es muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an old client of ours, who for more than 20 years has operated a bakery and pastry shop. She lives in the southern zone of the city and bakes meat pies, pastry, cakes, and makes sandwiches which she delivers to pastry and snack shops in the center of the city. Beatriz lives with her 2 children, who are already professionals and constantly travel. She works with her sister in this activity. Beatriz was left a widow 15 years ago and dedicates herself to her pastry shop. By means of this activity, she has advanced her children. As a client, Beatriz is very responsible in her payments, and this loan will be used to buy flour and other ingredients necessary for her bakery. On the siD., she also sells groceries on credit and collects monthly or weekly, according to the product, whichever proves convenient. Beatriz is very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FLOUR AND OTHER SUPPLIES FOR HER BAKERY

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal El Roble y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Rosa es casada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende lubricantes, también brinda el servicio de cambio de aceite, actividad que realiza todos los días con su esposo.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lubricantes.
Los sueños de Rosa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener local propio y trabajar para tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. What she enjoys the most about it are the savings incentives. Rosa, 34, is married and has three children. She has a rented location where she sells auto lubricants. She also provides vehicle oil change service every day with help from her husband. Rosa needs a 1250 sol loan to buy auto lubricants. Rosa’s dream is that her children become professionals, to own her own locale and to work to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy auto lubricants.

loans.name: Betty Yanet

texts.es:
Betty es socia del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” desde hace más de un año,  pertenece al distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene grado de instrucción superior completo.  Betty tiene un niño de seis meses.
Se dedica a la artesanía, hace bordados en telas, bayetas y en otros materiales, desde hace dos años no cuenta con un puesto seguro solo vende a los mayoristas. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró bayetas (telas) para el bordado.
Ella solicitará  un crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles para comprar  telas y lana.    
Su sueño es tener una tienda de artesanía. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los préstamos, ya que no piden muchos requisitos y también le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
Betty, 23, has been a member of “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank for over a year. It’s in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She has a live-in partner and finished higher education. She has a six-month-old son. She is a craftswoman. She has been embroidering on fabric, flannel and other materials for two years. She does not have a secure stand; she sells directly to wholesalers. She used the first loan she got from Manuela Ramos Movement which was for 500 new soles to buy flannel to embroider. She will now ask for an 800 new sol loan to buy more fabric and wool. Her dream is to own a crafts shop. What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the loans since they don’t ask for too many requirements; she also enjoys the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and wool.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma C. is from Dipolog City. She is 49 years old, married and has 6 adult-aged children. Elma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is 39 years old and married to Agripino M., a fisherman. She is an active member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., (ASHI) a partner MFI (microfinance institution) of Kiva in the Philippines. They are both involved in fishing and it is their primary source of income. Their residence is situated on an island in the heart of Laguna de Bay here in the Philippines. 

Her husband does the fishing and at the same time breeds fish fingerlings, while she sells the fish in the market. Their secondary source of income is a store, which she manages. 

They applied for a new loan of 30,000.00 Philippine pesos to buy stock of fish to sell in the market and to finance their fish breeding business. Part of the loan will be used to buy grocery products for her store. 

She hopes to have a better and improved business in order to earn money for the schooling of her three children. She wants to send them to college to earn a degree. She wishes to complete the construction of their house and have her own savings account with ASHI. All she hopes for is that Kiva lenders will support their goals in life and she guarantees to do her share to get out from poverty.

loans.use: To buy fish, to finance fish breeding and to buy grocery products for the store

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur N. is from the district of Agsu. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. 

He is the father of two children whom he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. It’s important to note that Seymur is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. For this reason, he applied for a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat loan to purchase three cattle to help him increase his income.

loans.use: Buy three cattle

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: akouvi est une femme de 34 ans, elle est célibataire. pour subvenir à ses propres charges, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de gagner plus de profits sur ses ventes. elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce commerce. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en: Akouvi is a 34 year old single woman.  To meet her needs, she started a business selling charcoal.  She buys her stock in the interior of the country so she can earn more profit on her sales.  She has ten years experience in this business.  She has already had one WAGES loan that she repaid on time; she is now seeking a second loan to buy about 20 bags of charcoal and to pay for their transportation.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Zzana Victory Development Group-Kampala

texts.en:
N. Rebecca, 48, a member of  Zzana Victory Development Group - Kampala, has been driving a roaring trade operating a poultry business for the last decade in Zzana. Like many other boisterous suburbs surrounding Kampala, Zzana is a trading center where chicken roasting is commonplace and a highly lucrative business venture that many people are rushing to enter. 

Previously a nurse in the civil service, Rebecca, a happily married mother of four, says she is a lady with willpower who in most instances relies on her beliefs for motivation. As part of her poultry business she sells eggs, and she also garners some side income from a drug store business, in total earning 120,000 shillings in weekly profits. With this loan, she is going to purchase mash for her layer chickens.

loans.use: The purchase of chicken mash for layer chickens

loans.name: Rosa Llunel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus tíos en el sector Gallito, una zona agrícola  del distrito de San José, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la ganadería. Ella cuenta con un grupo de vacas lecheras de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen con un acopiador que siempre visita la zona en donde reside, eventualmente la comercializa entre sus vecinos. Con los ingresos que ella obtiene de estas actividades ella se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Rosa desea adquirir una vaca de modo que pueda ver implementada su producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Rosa es una mujer bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de superarse y salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su calidad de vida..
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old, single, and lives with her aunt and uncle in the Gallito sector, an agricultural zone within the San José district, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works in the agricultural field, specifically raising livestock.  She has some dairy cows and sells the milk to a supplier who regularly visits the zone where she lives.  He eventually sells the milk to her neighbors.  She uses the money from the income she generates to cover her personal expenses and support her family financially.

Rosa wants to buy a new cow that she can integrate into her production, so she has seen fit to request a 1,500 PEN loan ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach her objective.

Rosa is a very responsible woman who has a great desire to get ahead.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can help her parents improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Mariana es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta y nos dice que le gusta todo, los créditos, los intereses bajos etc. Ella tiene 46 años de edad, es madre  soltera tiene un  hijo el mismo que ya es mayor de edad  y vive en su casa con su mujer y su pequeño hijo que la alegría de doña Mariana. 

Ella prepara y vende bocadillos, hamburguesas y dulces de muchas formas y sabores, trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 16h00, ella vende en su casa al menudeo y también al por mayor a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprarle sus productos, nos cuenta que esto lo viene realizando por muchos años ya que ella fue madre y padre a la vez, por lo que puso su negocio para sacar a su hijo adelante y que gracias a Dios nunca le falto nada.

Este crédito es para comprar ingredientes para la preparación de los productos que ella vende. Sus sueños son que su familia y ella tengan buena salud.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte, the members of the village bank La Unión Hace La Fuerza meet every 15 days.  This area is known for its delicious sweets that the locals make and that are recognized throughout the country.

Mariana is a founding member of the Village Bank and is very happy.  She says that she likes everything about it - the loans, the low interest rates, etc.  She is 46 years old and a single mother of one grown son who lives in her house with his partner and their small child, which brings Mariana joy. 

She makes and sells snacks, hamburgers and many types and flavors of candies.  She works every day from 9am until 4pm.  She often sells from her house, and also sells in bulk to businesses that come to her home to buy her products.  She tells us that she has been doing this for many years, since she had to be a mother and a father at the same time.  For that reason, she started her business to help her son get ahead, and thanks to God he has never lacked anything. 

This loan is to buy ingredients to make the products that she sells.  Her dream is that she and her family will be healthy.

loans.use: Buy sugar, eggs, flour, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children. Her business is selling shoes in Ave. Ejercito in Cusco, Peru. She is taking out the loan to reinvest in her  business by buying shoes such as sandals, tennis shoes, dress shoes, and kid's shoes in bulk from distributors. She is very happy with the loan, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To Invest in her shoe sales business

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.en:
Hermogenes G. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 42 years old. Hermogenes is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Hermogenes owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hermogenes has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Hermogenes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermogenes is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Hermogenes from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Por

texts.en: Mrs. Por S. is a widow with a child who is employed in a private company. She and her family live in Krang Touch village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also breeds pigs, and now she wants to breed a cow, too.  To support this goal, Mrs. Por S. is asking for a loan which, combined with her savings, will allow her to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. has been running a business cooking food in Dompoase, near Elmina, Cape Coast, for eight years. She sells rice with hardboiled eggs and stew. Rose is married to a farmer and they have three children. The income from her business helps pay for their children’s school fees and the family’s utilities bills. Rose aims to develop her business by increasing the amount and variety of food she sells. A loan will go towards purchasing more ingredients and the profits will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more shoe inventory.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella N. lives in the Nsiike Zone in  the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. 

Stella owns a shop selling cosmetics. She has been in this business for three years, and works 7 days out of every week. 

Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy hair weaves and cream relaxers for her shop.   The main business challenge for Stella is seasonality. 

Stella lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and cream relaxers

loans.name: Vecinos Y Amigos Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Vecinos y Amigos” y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. Todos ellos se dedican a diferentes rubros, específicamente venta en la feria de ropa interior, ropa y juguetes.
Gabriela es la presidenta del banco comunal y en la foto se encuentra al medio del grupo, viste una blusa blanca y un chaleco negro, los demás integrantes la señalan. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y juguetes en la feria desde hace 2 años. Gabriela trabaja todos los fines de semana en la feria y esporádicamente cuida a dos ancianos en una casa particular. Su mercadería la compra en diferentes lugares, los cuales sean convenientes económicamente.
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar un fardo de ropa (paquete grande de ropa usada).
Sus metas en su negocio son obtener un toldo grande, para utilizarlo como protección en la temporada de invierno, debido a la lluvia y en la temporada de verano, debido al intenso calor. Ya que actualmente Gabriela acomoda su mercadería encima de un paño en la calle. 
Ella vive junto a su hija de 26 años, quién la apoya los fines de semana en la venta de ropa. Sus sueños a nivel personal son poder independizarse económicamente, obtener y trabajar en un local que sea suyo. 
Gabriela está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste le permitirá invertir en su negocio, además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo de emprendedores, ya que son vecinos y conocidos. Por lo que las reuniones son muy amenas y se apoyan bastante. Respecto a los talleres realizados, Gabriela ha aprendido a como distribuir mejor los ingresos de su negocio. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Vecinos y Amigos” (Neighbors and Friends) and has 18 members from the city of Valparaíso.  They are all in different lines of work; specifically clothing, underwear and toy sales in the market.

Gabriela is communal bank President.  In the photo she’s in the middle of the group and is wearing a white blouse and black vest; the other group members are pointing at her.  She has been selling used clothes and toys in the market for the last two years.  She works every weekend in the market and sporadically cares for two senior citizens in a private home.  She buys her merchandise in various places, whichever is the most economically convenient.  She intends to use this loan to buy a bundle of clothes (a large package of used clothes).

Her goal for her business is to get a large awning to use as protection during the winter because of the rain and in summer because of the intense heat because currently Gabriela arranges her wares on a piece of cloth in the street.

She lives with her 26-year-old daughter who helps her on weekends with the clothing sales.  Her personal dreams are to become economically independent and to get a locale of her own to work in.

Gabriela is very grateful for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business.  Besides, she feels very comfortable in the group of entrepreneurs because they are neighbors and known to her.  Because of this, the meetings are very pleasant and they support each other quite a bit.   With respect to the workshops conducted, Gabriela has learned how to better distribute income earned from her business.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also the legislative seat of the country.  It is the country’s main port and offers a large variety of beautiful, picturesque places like, for example, Nobel Prize winning poet Pablo Neruda’s house.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector San Nicolas,  una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida desde hace 2 años. 

La creciente demanda que la bodega de María ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is a mother who is 54 years old and lives with her family in the San Nicolas sector, a marginal urban area in the city of Chiclayo which is a commercial zone located in Northern Peru.

She has a small store that she operates out of her house.  She sells a variety of daily consumption items and groceries to neighbors and customers in the area.  For two years business has been doing well.

The growing demand that Maria's store has been experiencing has made her think about expanding and acquiring more products.  This is why she decided to apply for a loan for 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy store merchandise

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like sardines, oils, groceries, etc.

Lilia has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from a repair shop.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sardines, oils, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Sbina

texts.en: Sabina is a 52-year-old widow with 4 children living in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda. She has no other dependents and her family goal is to educate her children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. Sabina has been running a retail business for 10 years but she faces a challenge of high food prices. Her desire is to have a wholesale business. Sabina needs the loan to buy sugar, rice, soap and cooking oil to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and cooking oil to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn crops on her land. Nilda makes sure her farm is free of weeds and pests so that her crops can grow healthy. She wants to be able to sell quality produce to the people in her community and has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

Nilda is 43 years old and married with four children. Her oldest child is 21 years old. Nilda wants to improve her skills in managing her business. She also wants to earn more to provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo, a 35-year-old farmer and father of two children aged four and two, lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Marcelo primarily grows rice to sell, a business he started five years ago which now earns him about 4000 PHP per month.

Marcelo's loan will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to have his own capital someday and be able to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luis Huberto tiene 19 años, es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofía, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz, frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos y los precios del mercado. Su sueño es tner una finca y comprar un vehiculo.

Le gusta estar con los padres y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Huberto is 19 years old, is single and lives with his parents, he has no children.

The communal bank is called October 27, it is located in the San Sofia neighborhood, part of the Ventanas area, they work in short cycle agriculture corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Luis works in agriculture, especially in corn, rice and beans. He buys his items each month in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same area.

Luis needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The support from the loan will help him meet his economic needs. Luis faces different challenges like plagues and diseases that hurt his crops. His dream is to have a ranch and to buy a car.

Luis enjoys being with his parents and doing sports.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Berbea

texts.en: Berbea is married and a mother of two school-age dependents. She is 29 years old and lives in Tongo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Berbea is a farmer. She plants and harvests vegetables to earn a living. She sells vegetables at retail and by volume to local traders. She has been in this type of business for five years. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay labor costs for land preparation. Berbea has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Berbea hopes to buy a hectare of land for vegetable production.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for land preparation.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato, 38 years of age, is married and blessed with six children. He has a rice farm, which he has owned for almost 17 years. Last cropping, his net income was 30,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to Renato who sees the loans as the only opportunity for progression of his agricultural business and financial security.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 28 years old and is single. Her business is well organized and she sells clothes such as adults' and children's clothes in the market. She has three years' experience. She works from 8am to 7pm every day except on Saturday and she currently employs one person to help her. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her clothing shop by purchasing various clothes such as adults' and children's clothes for resale. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To expand her clothing shop.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром умный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. С детства он интересовался скотоводством. Его дед и отец занимались этим бизнесом, он научился и   изучал все тонкие стороны бизнеса. Уже более 40 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и у него очень богатый опыт. Он ездит дальним кишлакам за перевозки стока, а затем продает их на местном рынке. Этот бизнес является единственный источникам дохода в его семьи, и он хочет, расширит данный бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль. Бахром хотел бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
