Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Bahrom is an intelligent and conscientious man. He is married and the father of three children. Since childhood he has been interested in animal husbandry. His grandfather and father were in the business. From them, he studied and learned all of the finer points of the business. He has been in business for more than forty years, and thus has extensive experience.  He travels to distant villages to buy their stock, and then sells it at the local market. This business is the sole source of income for his family, and he wants to expand this business to maximize his profit. Bahrom would like to take out a loan for $1,000 to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra de 22 años vive en el municipio de Soledad y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Allí se dedica desde el año 2007, a vender mediante catálogos o exhibidas, mercancías variadas como perfumes, ropa, cosméticos por encargo, en la modalidad de crédito a plazos pactados a 15 días,  con sus clientes. Entre su clientela se encuentran empleados, personal de la policía, familiares, vecinos, amigos y los referidos que día a día crecen. Cuando se aventuró a emprender una actividad que le generara ingreso fue apoyada por un familiar quien le prestó dinero, asi fue como se incorporó a una importante empresa para vender mediante catálogos sus productos como lo hace hasta la fecha, pero ahora también compra en la zona comercial de Barranquilla, otras mercancías que no tiene su catálogo. Con su negocio ha logrado captar una creciente clientela y comprar su vitrina, para exhibir la mercancía en casa de su madre, con quien vive en compañía de su hermano y su pequeña hija, con la que sueña ver convertida en una profesional exitosa y es el principal motor de su vida. Su sueño y gran desafío es lograr un almacén bien posicionado, especializado en la línea cosmética y en ropa. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, logrará tener un capital adicional para comprar ropa, cosméticos que tiene encargados y desea ser oportuna para no perder clientela. Su inversión resultará exitosa porque la hace sobre pedidos de sus más rentables clientes y en una época en la cual repuntan las ventas como el mes del amor y de la amistad, para el cual está preparada con su credikiva.
texts.en: Mayra, who is 22 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad. She has a daughter, who is 2 years old. There, since 2007, she has sold a variety of merchandise such as perfumes, clothing, and cosmetics through orders placed from catalogs or at exhibits. She sells on credit, with agreements with her customers for payments in two weeks. Her customers include employees, police staff, relatives, neighbors, friends, and people referred to her, who increase every day. When she ventured to begin this business which would generate income for her, she was supported by a relative who lent her money. This was how she started up an important business to sell her products through catalogs, as she has done up to this date,  but now she also buys in the commercial zone of Barranquilla from other merchants whose catalog she doesn't have. With her business, she has succeeded in attracting a growing customer base and in buying a display case to exhibit her merchandise in the house of her mother, with whom she lives, along with her brother and her little daughter, whom she dreams of raising to be a successful professional and is the main motivation for her life. Her dream and great challenge is to have a well-located store specializing in cosmetic lines and clothing. With her Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she will have additional capital to buy clothing and cosmetics for which she has orders, and she wants to do this in a timely manner so that she does not lose customers. Her investment will be successful since she still has orders from her most profitable clients and she will be prepared with her Kiva loan for the seasons in which sales rise, such as the month of love and friendship.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics for which she has orders that she wants to fill in a timely manner

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old, an enterprising business lady and a single mother of three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past eight years with the monthly income of KES 6,000 which she uses to support her children.


She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Catherine will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, and maize meal to add to her shop inventory. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and maize meal to add to her shop inventory.

loans.name: Marlene Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marlene, tiene negocio de pupusas en su casa, por las tardes sábado y domingo desde hace dos años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad.
Ella necesita el crédito para incrementar su negocio y para comprar materia prima como: quesillo, maíz para la masa, chicharrón, y de esa forma incrementar sus ganancias y darle una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
La aspiración de Marlene es aumentar en sus ganancias, crecer en su negocio y que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Marlene has a business in her home making pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  She works Saturday and Sunday evenings, and has been doing this for two years.  She lives with her husband and two children aged 7 and 10 years old.

She needs the loan to grow her business and to purchase raw ingredients such as cheese, corn for the dough, and pork crackling.  In this way she will increase her earnings and provide better service for her customers.

Marlene's aspiration is to increase her earnings and grow her business, and that her family will have everything it needs to live.

loans.use: to buy cheese, corn, and pork crackling for making her pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
With her desire to improve her family's standard of living, Leticia, a 59-year-old married mother of six, spends most of her time in her retail store business. In operation for five years, she earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month.

In order to expand the business, Leticia is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional groceries, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and rice to sell. She hopes to grow her general store to secure her family's future. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 47 years old and married. He is blessed with three children who are in school. His wife is a housekeeper. Romeo is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. He has been doing this business for 27 years. He usually earns an average income of P25,000 each crop. Sometimes his earnings depend on climate. It also depends on the seed variety he plants. Romeo’s habit is planting an inbred variety of rice because of its low cost. He has not enough capital to buy hybrid rice seed varieties because it’s costly.

Romeo desires to have a high yield and earn a higher income with every crop. He plans to plant hybrid rice seeds in order to obtain his desires. This situation leads him to request a loan of P27,000 to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides. Romeo is looking towards the success of his rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, ellas formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Luisa, ella tiene un copetín (lugar de venta de comidas) en el cual trabaja desde hace un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela. Comenta que tiene clientes que siempre acuden hasta su local para la compra de los alimentos que vende.
Ella pide la ayuda de fundación paraguaya para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos y otros.
texts.en:
The committee named “Maria Auxiliadora” was formed by several neighbors joining together from the city of Santaní. All of the members of this committee have developed independent business activities. They have formed a very close group that is capable of working together in activities that strengthen their friendships.

One of the members is Sra. Luisa. She has a snack bar that she has managed for some time and has built up a customer base. Luisa says that customers always come to her establishment to buy the food that she sells.

She is requesting assistance from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy needed supplies for preparing the dishes that she sells such as meat, chicken, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail, a 49-year old married father of three children, lives in Fort Portal, Uganda where he operates a butchery and rentals. His business challenges are price fluctuations and inadequate capital. His personal goals including educating his children and building a permanent house, while his business dream is to own a motorcycle to facilitate the transportation of meat. Ismail is requesting this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi, de 40 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, en toda su vida demostró ser una mujer muy luchadora y pujante ya que como es madre soltera, tuvo que criar a sus dos hijos sola, ellos tienen 16 y 11 años, y gran parte de lo logrado hasta ahora por ellos es por que siempre tuvieron una madre buena que siempre trabaja para brindarles lo mejor. Juntos habitan en una casa propia en donde ella les brinda educación y alimentación por que desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Deysi consiste en la cría de aves de corral, en la huerta de su casa, acondicionó un espacio muy amplio en donde tiene su corral y  cría entre 50 y 100 pollos. Cuando están listos para venderlos se va al mercado de su ciudad, para ofrecerlos  a sus principales clientes que siempre están a la expectativa dicho producto. Lleva trabajando con esta actividad ya por seis años y le sirvió para poder salir adelante y progresar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo, aunque al principio se enfrentó con muchos problemas, entre ellos el de no saber como el proceso completo o de no saber que tendría que ponerles su vacuna a cada pollo, pero ahora es todo una experta y cada día mejora en la crianza de estos animales. Este será el préstamo número 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará pollitos para iniciar con su crianza y alimento balanceados, además de algunas vitaminas y vacunas necesarias para el buen de las aves.
texts.en:
Deysi, 40, is a good, kind, very hardworking woman.  All her life she’s demonstrated being a very determined, strong woman who as a single mother had to raise her two children by herself.  Her children are now 16 and 11 years old and much of what she’s accomplished has been for them because they always had a good mother who always worked to give them the very best.  They live together in their own house where she provides them with education and food because she wants them to have a better quality of life.

Deysi’s work consists in raising barnyard fowl in her orchard.  She set aside an ample space for her corral and she raises between 50 and 100 chicks.  When they are ready to be sold she goes to her local market to sell them to her main customers who are always waiting for her products.  She’s been in this business for six years now and it's allowed her to prosper and get ahead.

What she likes about her work is that it allows her to manage her own time.  Although at first she faced many problems, among them not knowing the entire process or not knowing that she had to apply certain vaccinations to each chick, now she is quite expert and every day her care of these animals improves.

This will be MFP loan #14.  She is very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because that way she’ll feel sure to make progress with the business.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy chicks to start to raise and will buy nutritionally balanced feed as well as some vitamins and vaccines needed for the wellbeing of the fowl.

loans.use: to buy baby chicks, feed, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El Sr. Claudio es de la ciudad de Luque, está casado, tiene 36 años. El en conjunto a sus esposa tienen una joyeria y una despensa en su domicilio, tienen tres hijos uno de 11, otro de 5 y 2 años respectivamente.
El Sr. desde siempre se dedico a la joyería, empezó como ayudante, su señora fue costurera por varios años, con los ahorros que poseían y varios prestamos abrieron para su taller de Joyas y una despensa en su domicilio. Actualmente cuenta con varios clientes, lo cual les ayuda a mantener la casa y cubrir todos los gastos diarios de la casa.
El solicita el crédito para abastecer su joyería con pulseras, anillos, cadenas y demás tipos, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudio is from the city of Luque.  He’s married and he’s 36 years old.  Together with his wife he owns a home-based jewelry store and a grocery store.  They have three children who are 11, 5 and 2 years old respectively.

He has always worked in jewelry having started out as a street vendor.  His wife was a seamstress for many years.  With the savings they had and with several loans they opened their jewelry and their grocery store at home.  Currently, he has several customers which allows him to support his household and cover daily household expenses.  He’s asking for the loan to stock his jewelry store with bracelets, rings, chains and other types of jewelry to have more variety on hand to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Korandebe/gtng Group

texts.fr:
Ramadhan fait partie du groupe Korandebe/Gtng. Il a 42 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant de 13 ans, dont il est scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Ramadhan est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture. Dans les prochaines années, Ramadhan voudrait être le premier fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ramadhan is a member of the Korandebe/Gtng group. He is 42 years old, married, and has 1 child who is 13 years old and attends school. He has 5 years of primary school education.

Ramadhan is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to expand the surface area of his cultivation. Over the next couple of years, Ramadhan would like to become the largest supplier of rice in his region. With the profits, he plans to educate his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Solomon Kalunge

texts.en:
Solomon is a married man. He has two children, age 12 and 24 years. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as flour, milk, bread, margarine, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive environment. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of goods to be sold. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy breads, soda, sugar, flour, etc. His business goal is to diversify the store within five years.

loans.use: To buy more stock of breads, soda, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo Gustavo

texts.es:
Guillermo Gustavo tiene 22 años es soltero no tiene  hijos, vive con los padres y hermanos en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Guillermo Gustavo se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 8 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Guillermo Gustavo is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents and siblings in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre in the canton of Ventanas.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre, which is near the parish of Guare in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Guillermo Gustavo is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for eight years. He learned this trade from his parents. His purchases are made at the Jiménez Commericial Center in the city of Ventanas and he sells his products in the same city. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts for taking care of his crops. This will also help increase his family’s income. His dream is to have a house and a plot of land.

Guillermo Gustavo enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim is a 31-year-old Lebanese man who is married and lives with his wife and two children. He is the sole breadwinner in his family and works as a salesman for a local company. He is applying for a loan for $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s educational fees. In the future, he plans to take out more loans so that his children can get a good education.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra, vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona de tacagua, de la ciudad de la Paz, actualmente se dedica a la confeccion de chamarras y chalecos, segun el pedido que le hagan, realiza esta actividad con ayuda de su hijo quien se encarga de obtener los contratos. Ella usa maquinas industriales a pedal, la tela que recicla la usa para la elaboracion de almohadas, ella no desperdicia nada del material que usa y tampoco contamina el medio ambiente.

El credito que solicita es para concluir con la construccion de su vivienda, la misma que era de adobe y ahora es de ladrillo, el taller que tiene para su negocio ya es mas grande por lo cual esta mas limpio y todo esta acomodado. Necesita comprar madera para los pisos y pinturas y ventanas.

El sueño de Alejandra es terminar con la construccion de su vivienda.tener un taller y dar trabajo a otras personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in her own house with her husband and children in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. She currently works making jackets and pullovers to order. She does this work with the help of her son, who is responsible for finding customers. Alejandra uses industrial pedal machines and recycles material in order to make pillows. Alejandra does not waste any of the material she uses and is also not polluting the environment.

This loan will be used to finish building her home. It was made with adobe bricks but now is made with bricks. The workshop that Alejandra has for her business is now bigger and cleaner, and everything is set up for her work. Alejandra needs to buy wood for the floors, and paint and windows.

Alejandra's dream is to finishing building her home, to have a workshop and to give other people work.

loans.use: to buy wood for the floors, and paint and windows in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Mukisa Kyanamukaka Group

texts.en:
Mukisa Kyanamukaka Group is located in Kyabazi-Kabaale Kyanamukaka. It is a group of members who are committed to deliver and are well known as a very aggressive group in social economic aspects in their community. These members come from different villages but they all live in Kyanamukaka for business values.  They deal in agriculture (farming) and offering financial services (SACCO) to the community. This group works six days a week in their different activities and each day they work for eight hours on average but their greatest challenge is the lack of enough capital base to finance their activities.

Mrs. Eva, third from the right, is a member of this group. She joined this group business in 2010 with the aim of learning how to generate income after picking interest from group activities. At her early stage of joining. she is requesting a loan of UGX 3,000,000 with confidence to boost her business in order to broaden her financial base. She will, in particular, use the loan to buy organic fertilizers to improve the yield of her banana and vegetable gardens. Her main clients are local residents and traders from surrounding areas. 

The group's general objective is to lift up the standards of living of all their clients and customers to the next level but their biggest challenge is having low capital base.

They describe themselves as hard working in meeting deadlines and service delivery to all of their customers.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Eberardo

texts.es:
El socio sigue trabajando como profesor del nivel primario, el socio es una persona trabajadora que le gustaria sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener un negocio propio como una cabina de internet. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina para su casa.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eberardo continues to work as a primary school teacher. He is a very hard-working person who would like to get ahead with his children. His dream is to have his own business such as an internet stand.

He is requesting a loan to buy a stove for his house. He is happy with the loan and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy a stove for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Sinuu

texts.en: Sinuu is a 53 year old mother with 5 children, all grown up with two of them living in New Zealand and three still in Samoa working.  Sinuu owns about 8 acres of land in her village with 4 acres being used  by her business and the other four divided amongst her children in Samoa to work on.  She has been in the business for more than ten years now, and had been really successful with the support from her husband and children.  She aims to buy another 2 acres of land for her two children overseas, so that when they come back home they have a land to work and are able to continue her work.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers, chemicals, fungicides, and farm implements

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia has a beauty salon that she started with the help of her husband who gave her the start up capital. She was able to grow in the past 6 months thanks to a loan from the Kiva community. She did quite well with the loan she received. She was able to invest in her beauty salon as she planned. She bought some furniture for her shop and she made some improvements to the physical appearance of the shop. Her business is much more stable now and she is receiving many more clients. Now she is hoping that she can invest in more display cases and secondary products to sell from her store.

loans.use: Invest in furniture for the shop and complimentary products to sell

loans.name: Louch

texts.en: Mrs. Louch S. N. is 44 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia with her husband and their 4 children. Two of the children are still students. She makes and sells fried bananas. Her husband is a construction foreman. She wants to purchase a motorcycle for her husband who works far from their house. In the future, she would like to build a big store to increase their profit.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle as transport for her husband

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Ester was born in 1959 and is a widow with six children. Her husband left her and her children with nothing to live on so she was forced to work hard so she could provide for her six children. All attempts to do business proved unfruitful as she lacked capital. Motivated by other members, she sought help from GHAPE so she could get a loan and invest in a business. She received and repaid six loans with which she raised money to pay school fees and buy food for her children. Given a loan of $1000, she plans to continue her business of pig fattening and yam and cassava cultivation so she can use the profits to continue educating her children. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of food items and seeds and to hire labour

loans.name: Victor Sindolfo

texts.es:
Hi, my name is Victor Sindolfo. I have a grocery store in the center of my community. I operate it under the name "Pulperia Norma". I have years of experience in the small-store retail business. The income from this business allows me to cover my expenses and make other types of payments to my vendors. Thanks to previous loans, I've been able to fill up my inventory since my business is growing, but my customers' demands require me to yet again stock up. Since the busy Christmas season is approaching, I especially want to buy certain items like chicken and ribs to sell and provide better service to my customers. The profits I earn will allow me to sustain my family's needs and educate my children, since my store is the only source of income for our household.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Victor Sindolfo, cuento con una pulperia en el centro de mi comunidad,operando bajo el Nombre de Pulperia Norma, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias al prestamos que se me otorgo anteriomente pude surtir mas mi negocio, pero a las exigencias de mis clientes necesito surtirlo mas ya que mi negocio va creciendo y como ya viene la epoca navideña quiero comprar pollos y piernas de cerdo para vender y asi brindar un mejor servicio a mis clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia y educar a mis hijos ya que mi negocio es mi unica fuente de ingresos.

loans.use: Buy goods like sugar, salt, bread, beans, ham, fritters, soups, sauces, chiles, spices, oil, lard, pasta, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Christopher Agbon

texts.en: Mr. Christopher Agbon A., 38 years old, is married and has a child.  He lives in Benin City, and has a store where he sells plastic containers and other plastic products.  He is requesting a loan to buy more stock for sale.  He learnt his business from his mother and started his own in 1998.  He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products for sale

loans.name: Rosa Ilda

texts.es:
Rosa is 36 years old and has 3 kids. She has belonged to Nobleza Comunal bank for 12 years. In this last 12 years she have saved Money and raised her capital and built her house.

Rosa sells materials used for construction, activity that she learned from her parents. In the beginning she used to re-sell materials provided by her sister and now she brings the materials herself directly from the quarries. Additionally she buys bricks and burns them to get more revenue. Rosa needs a loan of $500, which will be invested in the purchase of concrete, sand and brick. Rosa’s dreams are to buy a car to transport the construction materials, to have a bigger business and that her kids will go to college.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa tiene 36 años y 3 hijos y pertenece al Banco Comunal Nobleza hace 12 años. En estos 12 años en su Banco Comunal ella pudo ahorrar y con ello pudo aumentar el capital de su negocio. Además construyó su casa, y nos cuenta que en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, puntual, solidaria y a compartir. Rosa vende materiales de construcción, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. En un inicio vendía materiales que le proveía su hermana pero en la actualidad Rosa trae los materiales directamente de las canteras. Además compra los ladrillos sin quemar y ella misma se encarga de quemarlos. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles que será invertido en la compra de hormigón, arena y ladrillos. Los ahorros de Rosa son para pagar las letras del mototaxi que compró hace 1 mes. Rosa sueña con comprar un carro para trasladar los materiales, que su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of $500, which will be invested to buy concrete, sand and brick.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario M. is single and, for the past 10 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of cheese. She tells us that from a young age she enjoyed the business and liked the work and, at thirteen years of age, she began working for someone else. She later decided to start her own business of selling cheese at the market in León.

She tells us that her business has always done well, due to the fact that she is in a good location and has been able to build a customer base. Rosario has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years, and is very satisfied with the loans that have been granted her at very opportune times. These have helped her supply her business, and to satisfy her customers on a daily basis. She has a record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario M. es una dama soltera que se dedica al negocio de venta de queso teniendo 10 años de tener este negocio, nos cuenta que desde joven le ha gustado el negocio, siempre le gusto el trabajo y por esto comenzó a la edad de trece a trabajar en la venta del queso, pero esta venta era de una señora a quien ella le trabajaba, hasta que decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de queso en el mercado la Terminal de León.

Nos cuenta que en el negocio siempre le ha ido bien ya que la ubicación es muy buena y además ha logrado captar clientes. Por este motivo es que la señora Rosario trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues le han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is a 45-year old widow with seven children.  Two of her children are married and live away from the family. Two other children work as construction laborers and earn around $3 a day, while the other one is employed in a garment factory with a salary of $70.  The last two are students. Meas usually stays at home cooking food for the children. While at home, she runs a small business growing a variety of vegetables, earning on average $1 a day. Her family would like to borrow $600 to purchase a motor for the children to commute each day to work and school.

loans.use: Purchase a motor for the children to commute.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi's Muafaka Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is 32 years old and is married with 1 child, age 20. Mwanamkasi owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanamkasi has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zaitun and Fatuma, who also have restaurants.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Zaida Antonia

texts.es:
Zaida is a single mother and is 38 years old, she lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood. With her mother's help she has been able to establish herself as a retailer and help her children who are 16 and 4 years old. 3 years ago, she was able to start a business from her home selling items where she does well and is able to make an income. Her mother however, has a business of basic grains who Zaida needs to support because of her mother's bad health. She will be taken care of her mother's store to be able to keep it running for which she needs working capital to keep the sales permit and store location.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Zaida es una madre soltera de 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio de Villa Venezuela con ayuda de su señora madre ha logrado establecerse como comerciante y sacar adelante a sus hijos de 16 y 4 años de edad. Hace 3 años logró poner un negocio en su casa de venta de ropa usada en donde le va bien y logra tener algunos ingresos. La madre de Zaida tiene un negocio de ventas varias, como granos básicos, perecederos y frutas, pero ella se encuentra mal de salud, por lo que Zaida de ahora en adelante se hará cargo del negocio y lo administrará, es por eso que solicita el crédito, para poder levantar el negocio y nodejar perder el mismo, ya que perdería tambien el permiso de venta y también el local.

loans.use: Working capital for store location

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana started her business in order to help her 4 children get ahead: Samuel, 18 years of age works at a car wash, Liliana is a 16-year-old married homemaker, and Josué and Yaresi, both 12-year-old students. Juana did not have enough money with her husband’s income because he does not have a steady paycheck picking oranges. She started her business 17 years ago, helping out her mother who sells used clothing for a living. Juana then started to purchase clothing as well and set up a stand in her house and in markets.

She now needs a loan of $350.00 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, so that she can obtain more merchandise and resell it. With your help, Juana will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana incio su negoico para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos: Samuel de 18 años quien trabaja como lavacoches, Liliana de 16 años es casada y se deica al al hogar, Josué de 12 años estudia y Yaresi de 12 años, estudiante; ya que no completa con el sueldo de su esposo porque es muy inetsable ya que se dedica a la recoleccion de naranja. Comenzó su negocio hace 17 años ayudando a su mama quien se dedica la vente de ropa usada y de ahí aprendio y empezo a comprar ella tambien ropa y poner un puesto en su casa y en mercados rodantes.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mas mercancía para la reventa. con tu ayuda Juana saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Comité Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Sixteen members are integrating into this group, which is currently in it’s sixth loan cycle. The women joining the group are dedicated to various activities, from those that allow them to focus on selling fast food, drinks, and food kiosks, to selling fruit in general.

This group has a desire to progess that is evidenced by an insistence that every member is dedicated to her work daily. Regarding the group, it’s a small group with a lot of experience, which stresses fluid communication and is a good organization for it’s members.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, pasta, clothing,  jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Fardus

texts.en:
Fardus is 47 years old, married and has two children ages 20 and 14. She owns and runs a small general store. She started her business in 1990 and works every day from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. She earns a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Fardus has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell from her store.

loans.use: To increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: Asha's Jiimarishe Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 2, 3 and 4. She also takes care of 2 other children aged 6 and 8 years old. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 250 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Asha now seeks a loan to buy charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sikudhani.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Hamisa is widow with three adult children. She became a khanga (a brightly colored piece of cloth that many East African women wear over their skirts while working in the fields) and bread seller in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Hamisa is seeking a loan to buy more khanga and bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and bread.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is the mother of one adorable daughter. For almost four years, she has been selling dried fruits at the markets. In order to buy fruits, she goes to other cities which are far away from her house about twice a week and buys fruits there from people for a cheaper price. Then, she brings them home and dries them, which takes about a week. After that she sells them at the markets.

Now, everything is getting expensive, so she wants to borrow money to buy more fruits and offer them to her clients. This way, she can also earn more money to help her husband to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. Yoem M. is a 56-year-old farmer in Svay Thom Village in Takeo Province. Her husband name is Min Song. They are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice; unfortunately, their field is increasingly infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Yoem M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers for their field. Mrs. Yoem M. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a driver, and the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for their fields

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, siembra los principales productos de su región, en este tiempo ha visto la ganancia de muchos años, pero también las pérdidas por los cambios climáticos bruscos y ahora trabaja con mucha dedicación en escoger las semillas, trabajo previo a la siembra, lo bueno es que cuando cosecha siempre hay personas que le compran al por mayor casi toda su cosecha, también cría animales que son otra buena opción de generar ingresos económicos cuando está esperando la época de cosecha, de esta manera solventa los gastos de su familia, más que nada de sus hijos quienes están estudiando y se necesita de todo ese ingreso para cubrir sus gastos. Es la segunda vez que Nancy está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, la primera vez demostró ser puntual en sus pagos. Esta cantidad de dinero será invertida en la compra de abono para sus tierras de cultivo y también un torete.
texts.en:
Nancy is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children. She has been a farmer for most of her life, growing the primary products of her region. Over the years she has seen profits but also losses due to abrupt weather changes. Now she is working with great dedication to select the seeds, a job to be done prior to planting. The good thing is that when she harvests there are always people that purchase almost her entire harvest from her at wholesale. She also raises animals that are a good option to generating income while waiting for the harvest. In this way she can meet her family’s expenses, above all her children’s education expenses and she needs to use this income to cover her expenses. This is the second time Nancy is asking for a loan with MFP, and she was punctual with her payments on her first loan. This quantity of money will be invested in purchasing fertilizer for the land where she grows her crops and also in a young bull.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a young bull

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. is a 48 year old trader. She is married and the mother of six children, who are all currently in school. She trades tomatoes and other vegetables on top of a table in the local market of Konongo Agogo in the Ashanti region of Ghana, where she lives. She says that through this business she has endeavored to support three of the kids to finish senior high school.

She requests this loan to enable her buy increased stock of tomatoes to grow and scale up her business progress. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her save more to support her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of tomatoes.

loans.name: Sruon

texts.en: Mrs. Sruon T. is a villager in Tnaut village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuth Vy, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sruon T. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, piglet, and pig feed for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is 34 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on her left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow, piglet, and pig feed for breeding.

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr: Ndèye Coumba S., 46 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 5 ans et demi.. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de denrées alimentaires (riz, huile, oignons, jumbo, poivre ail etc.). Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba S., age 46, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for five and a half years. She wants to bolster her business selling grocery items (rice, oil, onions, Jumbo bouillon cubes, pepper, garlic, etc.) The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell grocery items in a booth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his arable lands and to buy manure

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita A., 39, is married with seven children.  She has two years of experience in the Chips business. She sells to the village people and public six days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.  SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags, banana, oil, and cooking utensils

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru: Шохида и ее муж продают женские сумки. Шохиде 29 лет. воспитывает 2 детей. Каждое утро она отводит своих детей в детский сад, а сама отправляется на свое рабочее место торговать. Она арендует небольшое место в новом здании торгового центра. За товаром ездит ее муж на оптовые рынки, а недавно он стал ездить и на оптовый рынок в соседний Кыргызстан. Ассортимент сумок включает в себя как дешевые так и дорогие модели сумок. Шохида собирается включить в ассортимент новые модели и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Shohida and her husband are in the business of selling purses. She is 29 years old and has 2 children. Every morning, she drops her kids off at a kindergarten and then goes to work. She rents a spot in the new building of a trading center. Her husband purchases inventory from wholesale markets. Recently, he began importing goods from neighboring Kirghistan. The assortment of purses includes a wide price range of inventory. Shohida applied with Kiva so they could purchase a new line of purses and expand their inventory.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es:
el Sr. Francisco cuenta con un taller de tapiceria, ubicado en la colonia San Francisco, esta es una colonia muy populosa de Comayaguela, tiene 10 años de experiencia en este tipo de trabajo, su negocio esta equipado con todas las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar cualquier tipo de trabajo, el tiene muchos clientes fijos y ellos tambien lo recomiendan con otras personas ya que su calidad de trabajo es muy buena, tambien hace trabajos en vehiculos, el vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el sueño del Sr. Francisco es construir una segunda planta a su casa y asi poder ampliar su negocio, el en su vecindario es muy querido por todos ya que tiene una costumbre todos los años de celebrarle el dia del niño a todos los niños que viven cerca de donde el y todos estos gastos son cubiertos por el mismo.
el ha tenido una vida dura ya que desde muy niño le toco empezar a vender periodicos en las calles, luego crecio y logro poner su taller con mucho sacrificio. en la colonia todo mundo lo conoce por PACO.
texts.en:
Francisco has an upholstery workshop, located in the San Francisco neighborhood, a populous section of Comayaguela. He has 10 years experience in this type of work. His business is equipped with all of the necessary tools to do his work, and he has many dedicated clients, who also recommend him to others because his work is so good. He also works on cars. He lives with his wife and their two children. Francisco's dream is to build a second floor on his house, in order to expand his business. He is very well liked in his neighborhood, and has a custom of celebrating Children's Day with all of children that live near him, covering all of the costs himself. Francisco has had a very difficult life. When he was a child he started selling newspapers in the streets at a very young age. Later, after he grew up, he made many sacrifices in order to start his workshop. In his neighborhood everyone knows him as Paco.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, sponges and wood

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is thirty-eight years of age, married, and currently has no child. She says she lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Mary trades in eggs. She buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farming communities and sells them on a table at the community market. She also supplies to food vendors in her community and treks to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

Mary has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs in bulk

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a widow and has 4 dependants. She did not receive any form of education. Esi has been a food vendor in Ekuase, near Cape Cost, since 1999. She sells Kenkey, a local food made out of corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in cornhusk. Esi uses her income for feeding the family. Esi will use the loan to buy maize to enable her to prepare the Kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy maize to prepare for making Kenkey.

loans.name: Morine

texts.en:
She is a mother of seven children. Life has been a living hell for her and her children ever since she was attacked by thieves and of all her belongings were taken away. When GHAPE extended its services to Belo Sub-Division where she lives, she saw the dawn of a new and promising day with GHAPE. She received her first loan of 40.000 FCFA in 2007 which served as her take-off capital. Her greatest dream is to be able to build a house of her own some day and also increase her farm land.

With her second loan, she plans to buy palm oil, salt, packets of maggi, and goats for rearing. The profit she gets from this loan shall be used to pay for her children’s education and provide food, clothing, and medication for them.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of palm oil, salt, maggi and goats

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. has a small shed and under its roof she does her selling of kenkey at Amisanu in Elmina. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper. Mary prepares kenkey from maize and sells the food with fried fish.

Mary has received no formal education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Mary is responsible for paying fees and bills.

Mary has been selling kenkey since 2000. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to increase her production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more maize to increase her production of kenkey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing sweet potatoes and corn

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel R., a 35-year-old mother of three children, with 16 years old the eldest has been heartily toiling hard for her piggery and rice farm business. Currently, she and her husband raises 4 pigs and tills a 2-hectare farm to get income to support her children. .

She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more piglets and feed. Some of the loans will also use to finance farming needs like buying the fertilizers and seeds.

She is happy with CEVI services because aside from the fact hat it offers small interest rate of only 2% a month, the staff are very kind and concern to their business growth.

loans.use: pigs and feed

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu R. es una mujer emprendedora y  dinámica, tiene 46 años, es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, ellos trabajan junto a su mamá en el negocio, pues ella se dedica a preparar tortas y decorarlas, también hace Buffett para reuniones y agasajos.  Cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposo, él es chofer de ómnibus. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en ingredientes e insumos para decoración de tortas. 
Con este préstamo de 2000 soles, piensa comprar un motocarro que le facilitará el transporte de sus materiales de trabajo, y los productos que ofrece. La meta de Marilu es construir un local de recepciones, bien implementado donde pueda ofrecer sus productos a los clientes.
texts.en:
Marilu R. is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She is 46 years old and is the mother of four adult children who work alongside their mother in her business. She bakes cakes and decorates them. She provides buffets for parties and social events as well. She also gets help from her husband who is a bus driver. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she invested in ingredients and supplies for cake decorating. With this loan of 2000 soles, she hopes to buy a car to make it easier to transport her working materials and her final products to her clients. Marilu's goal is to build a well-designed reception hall where she can offer her products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car to transport her products

loans.name: Jaime Rolando

texts.es: El joven padre D. familia el señor Jaime rolando y su esposa la señora Liliana son padres D. un pequeñito, el labora para una empresa como operador desD. hace 2 años su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar. Están solicitando este crédito para la colocación D. impermeabilizante ya que ahora que es temporada D. lluvias quieren proteger su techo y su hogar.

loans.use: Colocacion de impermeabilizante en el techo de su hogar

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 2 Y 3 Group

texts.en:
Enelcida is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor (Faith and Love). Her story is representative of the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Her group is based around the city of La Romana, an area where the economy centers around the sugar cane industry and in which there is limited access to running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. Here, she makes her home as a single mother with her six children.

Enelcida has proven herself to be a reliable associate of Esperanza and this will be her sixth loan with us after having paid back her first five without problems. She is excited to take this loan to continue developing her fried food stand. With this loan she will buy salami, flour and cooking oil for her business. She hopes to use the profits to continue constructing her home. Her dream is to have a well constructed home for her children so that they can be safe and continue their studies. They thank you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy Salami, Flour and cooking Oil

loans.name: Amera

texts.en: Amera Q. and her husband, Lorenzo, are engaged in the fishing business in their small village in Tabao, Zone 2, Valladolid, Negros Occidental, in the Philippines. They started off in this business without owning a fishing boat, even a small one, as they had no money to purchase one. Their recourse then was to hitch a ride with other fishermen in their boats, fish and sell the fish to the local community. However, with a lot of hard work and a desire to improve not only their quality of life but also the education of their three children, Amera joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 and slowly they were able to improve their business. They were able to buy their own fishing boat, purchase more nets, venture into catching crabs, and now they are able to sell these not only in the local community but also to businessmen, who sell their crabs and some fish in the big cities, getting them more margin on their catch. Now on her 13th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amera earns between P6-16,000 a month from the business, which helps a lot in providing for their household expenses and sending her three children to school, and even allowing them to expand their fishing business. For her next loan, Amera needs P19,500 to purchase materials to build more nets to catch bigger crabs. At the same time she will use some of the money for additional working capital for the business, which will allow them to increase their catch and hopefully, save more money in the hopes of adding a few fishing boats to their fleet in the near future. About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To make more nets and provide additional working capital.

loans.name: Militina

texts.es:
la señora Militina D. F. tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de queso, quesillo y mantequilla, vive en union libre con el señor Manuel Enrique Gallardo, no tinen hijos. Su negocio es vender lacteos y esta ubicado en el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, todos los dias va a su puesto a vender su producto, muchas personas visitan el mercado a diario.
esta solicitando el credito para compra de queso y quesillo, ya que en esta epoca las ventas se mejoran y la demanda es mayor.
su sueño es tener varios puestos de venta de quesos y quesillo en varios lugares de San Lorenzo y Nacaome.
texts.en:
Militina D. F., 38, sells cheese, quesillo (a soft cheese), and butter. She lives with her life partner, Manuel Enrique Gallardo, and have no children. She sells dairy products in the new San Lazaro market. She goes to her stall every day to sell her products since many people visit the market daily. She is asking for financing to buy cheese and quesillo since sales tend to increase during this season and demand is greater. Her dream is to have several cheese and quesillo selling stands in varios locations in San Lorenzo and Nacome.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, quesillo (a soft cheese), and butter.

loans.name: Pius Okoth

texts.en:
Pius Okoth is a 36-year-old married man and father of three children. He is married to Lucy, who is 32 years old. To earn a living, he is a poultry farmer, and he has been in this business for the last seven years, rearing predominantly broilers. In addition, he serves as a community nurse in a nearby medical clinic. He explains that he used his savings from the community nursing job to start his poultry business. His clients are cafe operators in Kisumu City, with whom he has signed contracts to supply them with poultry, thereby ensuring a steady market (and demand) for his poultry meat.

He is now seeking a second loan from KADET, the proceeds of which he plans to use to purchase additional chicks for rearing and to purchase poultry feed. He learned about KADET from a friend, who was an existing client. He aspires to further diversify his income sources by venturing into horticulture; you see, he lives next to a river, which he intends to use for irrigation.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. Specifically, KADET provides financial services to thereby improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additonal chicks and feed

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo C. is 34 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a father of six children: one is married and lives separately, the second two work as motor taxi drivers, and the last three are going to school. He is married to Thy, 31, who sells clothes and some cooking ingredients in front of her home. Keo C. owns a tuk tuk (motorbike taxi) and has provided a transportation service throughout the whole town of the province since 2002. Keo C. has recently had problems with the taxi because it's too old to run and not attractive to the customers. So he is looking for his second loan of $700 to buy a new tuk tuk for his service.

loans.use: To buy a new tuk tuk for his taxi service

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Mrs. Leonida B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Together with her husband (shown in the photo), Leonida owns and operates a business selling spices in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns 2,500 PHP net monthly. In 2009, Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar M. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old. Oscar is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Oscar owns and operates a business of buying and selling dried fish. Sometimes he also has a supply of processed food like hot dogs or longganisa (pork sausage flavored with indigenous spices) to sell in the local community. Oscar is just starting this business.

In 2009, Oscar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Oscar is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to build up his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 41 años, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida ella ofrece los platillos como gallo pinto, cuajada, queso frito, refrescos naturales, empanadas de maduro, pollo frito, carne asada, enchiladas y tacos la buena calidad de sus productos la hacen muy famosa con sus clientes, pues ella cocina delicioso y el ambiente es las afueras de su viviendas pues algunos clientes solo piden comida para llevar y en algunas circunstancias se quedan a comer ahí en su negocio, por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia no fue fácil pero ella es una persona muy admirable. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar los productos básicos necesarios. Ella sueña en convertir su pequeño negocio en un restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosario, 41, creates and sells meals such as chicken with beans, cottage cheese, fried cheese, natural soft drinks, plantain pastries, fried chicken, roast beef, enchiladas and tacos. The top quality of her products have made her famous with her clients, because her cooking is delicious. The setting is outside her home. Some clients come to order a meal to take out, and sometimes they stay to eat at her business. She says that starting up was not easy for her, but she is an admirable person. This financing is for working capital, to buy the necessary basic products. She dreams of converting her small business into a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Javhlanbayar

texts.en: Javhalanbayar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Umnugobi province, Mongolia. His wife is a housewife and takes care of the two daughters, ages 8 and 3. His oldest daughter is in secondary school and the youngest is in kindergarten. He and his family lives in a “ger”, a traditional Mongolian tent.  After working as a fireman for several years, Javhalanbayar decided to start his own business. In 2009, he purchased tire repair equipment with a loan from Xacbank and started his tire repair business. The profits from his tire repair business have allowed him to build a working place in his yard. After years of successful business operations, Javhalanbayar has earned a good reputation among his customers for his excellent repair work. He hopes to have a sustainable workspace and large auto repair shop in the future. Also he wants to start a grocery shop in his yard so that his wife can earn money to supplement to their earnings. He says, “I am working hard in order to build a grocery shop for the future.” He is requesting a loan of 4,100,000 tugrugs to buy a truck for his business.

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. N., a 50-year-old married mother, lives with her husband and children in a wooden house located in a commune in the province of Siem Reap. There, she earns a living producing mats for sale. The raw material she uses to weave mats is from palm leaves and thatch.

In addition, her husband earns a daily income by fishing in and around Tunle Sap. Fishing is very profitable for the family. However, recently, the quantity of fish is decreasing due to some of his equipment being broken. Because of this, N. is asking for a loan to buy more fishing equipment.

The couple has seven children: three are married and four are single.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment for her husband

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is 36-year-old woman. She lives in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. 
Her husband's name is L. A. and he has a paint-selling business. He runs a paint shop in the community and also offers painting services to his customers. Salma is also a very hard-working lady. She runs her own clothes-selling business. Her clientele base is in her community. They give her orders for seasonal clothes. She travels once a month to various cities (Lahore & Multan) to purchase the clothes. Her earning allows her to think about the betterment of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy cans of paint to expand her husband’s paint-selling business. 

Salma has three other ladies in her loan group. Shamim akhtar wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bilquis wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and rice) for her food stand. Another Shamim akhtar wants a loan to buy cans of paint to resell.

loans.use: To buy cans of paint to sell

loans.name: Birashoboka Group

texts.fr:
Dancile B. a 36 ans. Elle est mariee et mere de 6 enfants dont quatre filles.  L’ainee est age de 13 ans et etudie en 6e primaire et le cadet a 11 mois. Dancile espere que ses enfants finiront leurs etudes avec succes et qu'ils seront des leaders. Elle a tant fait pour eux qu’elle souhaite se promener en ville un jour dans le vehicule de ses enfants et conduite comme une reine.

Dans sa vie quotidienne, elle bute aux defis lies aux depenses de ration, des frais scolaires  et  des medicaments pour soigner ses yeux.  L'argent qu'elle gagne satisfait ses besoins grace au business qu'elle a commence en 2000.  

Depuis lors, Dancile est proprietaire d’une kioske a Gihosha ou elle vend des produits alimentaires et divers.  Parmi eux, les plus lucratifs sont le haricot, l’huile de palme, et le sucre.  Elle cultive aussi des haricots, mais, patates douces et du manioc.  Elle va utiliser ce credit pour acheter des produits destines a son commerce.
texts.en:
Dancile B. is 36. She is married and the mother of 6 children of whom four are girls. The oldest girl is 13 and studies in 7th grade. The youngest is a boy of 11 months. Dancile hopes that her children will finish their studies successfully and that they will be leaders. She has done so much for them so she hopes one day to be driven around town in their car and treated like a queen. In her everyday life, she runs up against challenges relative to feeding the family, paying school fees, and paying for medicine for her eyes. The money she earns is enough to support them thanks to the business she began in the year 2000. Since then, Dancile has been the owner of a kiosk in Gihosha where she sells groceries and various other items. The most lucrative are dried beans, palm oil, and sugar. She also grows beans, maize, sweet potatoes, and manioc. She will use the loan to buy products to sell in her little store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing groceries to sell in her little store

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe JIGUIYA sont toutes mariées. Elles  avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames   à  Siekourani un village de la  sous préfecture de Loulouni  région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur quinzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’accroitre leur chiffre d’affaire.  
Ce groupe de femme mène la vente de tomates fraîches, de poissons fumés, de bois de chauffe et de tubercules tels avec Assa Bagayoko.
Assa B. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50  chargements de charrettes en  ignames. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et dans les foires des villages voisins. 
L’igname est  revendu en détail au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Jiguiya group are all married with five children each and an average age of 42. They mainly live in polygamous families in Siekourani, a village in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, Sikasso - the third largest administrative region of Mali. They are on their fifteenth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso region, with the aim of boosting their business revenues. The group members, such as Assa Bagayoko, sell fresh tomatoes, smoked fish, firewood and tubers. She aims to use her loan to buy 50 cartloads of yams, sourcing her goods from the Loulouni market and from the neighbouring villages. The yams are sold for cash at the Loulouni market to a male and female customer base. She expects to generate an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA; a proportion of this will be used to save towards social ends and the rest will be re-invested in the business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing yams

loans.name: Kyamwasha Bakyara Kwebisaho, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
The hard work and creative nature of R. Donosio has seen him operate a thriving business handling local brew, commonly referred to as “waragi” here in Uganda. The married father of eleven children has been running this business for the last thirty-five years in Kyamwasha, Ntungamo district.

Donosio’s current setback is having insufficient capital to purchase the materials used, including bananas whose prices have hiked, thus leaving the brewing behind. Therefore, this loan will help him to revive his business in terms of expansion and also be able to earn more revenue.

loans.use: To purchase more materials, like bananas, for making local brew

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos que estudian. Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Isabel inicio su negocio vendiendo frutas de manera ambulatoria en el mercadillos Señor de Arequipa y hace 2 meses tiene un puesto estable en donde exhibe de mejora manera sus productos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Isabel sueña con tener una tienda en su casa.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de naranjas, manzanas, plátanos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 40 years old and lives with her partner and her five school-aged children. She is a member of the Hormigas village bank. She began her business selling fruits in the Señor de Arequipa street markets and for the past two months has maintained a fixed stand where she can better display her products, something she does every day with her daughter's help. Isabel's dream is to have a store in her home. She requests a loan of 2000 soles to invest it in the purchase of oranges, apples and bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase oranges, apples and bananas

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario G.  se encuentra casado, tiene 2 hijos uno de tres añitos y el otro recién nacidito. Vive en la comunidad de Cazorla de la provincia mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. 
 
El Sr. Mario es el hermano mayor de toda su familia, por recursos bajos  de sus papás el sigue colaborando en el estudio y la alimentación a sus hermanos menores que siguen estudiando en la escuela. Su esposa y él se dedican a la producción agrícola en los terrenos de su padre, se apersono a las oficinas para solicitar un crédito para comprar un terreno agrícola y así  poder trabajar en sus propios terrenos y aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y de toda su familia. 

El Sr. Mario también desea comprar una vaca para bajar sus gastos de alimentación de sus hermanos menores y tal vez en un futuro ellos puedan tener más vacas y dedicarse a la producción de leche cruda.
texts.en:
Mario is married, and has 2 children, 1 to 3 years old, plus another recently born. He lives in the community of Cazorla, Mizque Province, Cochabamba Department. Mario is the elder brother in his family. Due to his parents' limited resources, he continues to collaborate in the education and maintenance of his younger brothers who are still studying in school. His wife and he produce agricultural products on his father's land. He has approached our offices to request a loan to buy agricultural land, to be able to work their own lands and increase their income and improve their quality of life as well as that of their family. Mario also wishes to buy a milk cow in order to lower the costs of feeding his younger brothers and, perhaps, in the future they can have more cows and begin production of raw milk.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING AGRICULTURAL LAND AND A MILK COW

loans.name: Sima

texts.fr:
En 2007 S. sima s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale , elle s’approvisionne dans divers marchés locaux de lomé. Elle est en rupture de stock et veut s’approvisionner pour  pouvoir rehausser son stock et ses ventes. elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de 4 cartons de savons BF, 6 cartons de savons popular, 5cartons de RAD liquide, 6 cartons de sardines, 3 cartons de couscous sipa, 4 cartons de sucre et 4 cartons de mayonnaise jago
Elle est célibataire et c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle assume ses propres charges
texts.en:
In 2007, S. Sima embarked on a business involving groceries. She gets her supplies from various local markets in Lomé. She is low on stock and wants to stock up again to be able to enhance her inventory and her sales. She is requesting a loan for buying 4 boxes of BF soaps, 6 boxes of popular soaps, 5 boxes of liquid RAD, 6 boxes of sardines, 3 boxes of SIPA couscous, 4 boxes of sugar, and 4 boxes of Jago mayonnaise. Sima is unmarried, and with the revenues from her business, she supports herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Mujeres De Chitocche Group

texts.es: Doña Antonia H. R. persona D. 34 años D. edad, casada tiene 3 hijos en total, 1 hombre y 2 mujeres, doña Antonia es una persona que desD. hace 10 años se dedicaba a la venta D. ropa para niños y que quiere apoyar a su familia, actualmente ha habido un incremento en la canasta básica en cuanto a sus precios, por lo cual ella se ve en la necesidad D. apoyar con los gastos familiares, ya que sus hijos estudian y realizan gastos con sus hijos. Entonces deciD. formar un grupo con sus vecinas que desD. hace unos 15 años se conocen con el opnjeto deaumentar el capital D. sus negocios, y así incrementar sus ganancias para poder darle un mejor futuro a la familia D. cada uno D. las integrantes del grupo.
texts.en:
Doña Antonia H. R. is 34 years old, married, and has three children, a son and two daughters. She has been selling children’s clothing for ten years and she wants to continue supporting her family. However, the prices of basic household items have increased. For this reason Antonia is requesting assistance with the family expenses, her children’s education, and their other personal expenses.

She decided to form a group with her neighbors so that they could increase their business capital. They have known one another for 15 years. By increasing their earnings, they will be able to proviD. a better future for each of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for household & educational expenses

loans.name: Edwin
