texts.es: El Señor Edwin  es un cliente que ya saco varios créditos en la institución, demostró puntualidad en los pagos, el tiene la actividad de venta de DVDs en el alto específicamente tiene dos puestos uno en la avenida Panorámica y otro en la ceja eje central de la ciudad de el alto, el actualmente compra los DVDS  en la frontera del Perú a un precio muy bajo y los vende en la ciudad de el alto, el ahora quiere incursionar en el quemado de los DVDs  así ahora el produciría los DVDs desde el quemado hasta la venta, el señor Edwin es una persona muy innovadora, en la actualidad el señor Edwin no tiene pareja pero piensa en futuro para crear un buen capital para su futura familia, el crédito será invertido en la compra de una torre quemadora que lo utilizara en el quemado de los DVDs.
texts.en:
Edwin is a client who has had several loans with the institution. He has demonstrated punctuality with his payments. Edwin sells DVDs in El Alto. He has two stands; one is on Panorámica Avenue. The other is in the La Ceja, the central hub of El Alto. He currently buys the DVDs on the Peruvian border at a very low price. He sells them in the city of El Alto. He now wants to venture into burning the DVDs. That way he would produce the DVDs from the time he burns them until he sells them Edwin is a very innovative person. At the present time he does not have a life partner. He thinks about the future and making good money for his future family. He will use the loan to buy a DVD burner tower, which he will use to burn the DVDs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a DVD burner tower

loans.name: Asovale

texts.en:
Asovale K. is 43 and married with six children (ages 9 - 19).  She owns a business venture planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Asovale has five years of experience in this business.  Asovale needs a loan of WST $2,900 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Asovale joined SPBD. This is her fifth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asovale's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Carlos Rolando

texts.es:
El Sr. R. M. Carlos Rolando tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años a los cuales le pasa una pensión mesual y el tiene un ingreso semanal de s/. 280.
Se dedica a realizar actividades de maestro de obra hace cinco años y solicita el préstamo con la finalidad de ir mejorando profesionalemtne y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos Rolando R. M. has two children, ages 13 and 10, for whom he must pay a monthly pension. He also has a weekly income of 280 PEN.

Carlos has engaged in various activities as a master builder for five years. He is requesting a loan in order to keep improving professionally and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom R., 33, is married and lives with her husband and two of her children in Takeo province. Since 1999, she has been growing rice, and she is able to earn less than US$1 each day. Her husband is a cow dealer. He buys and sells cows in the village and, on average, he earns an income of US$5 per day. This couple is also supported by one child who works in a garment factory. To earn more income to raise her standard of living, Mom R. is asking for a loan of US$600 to trade cows.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Suom

texts.en: Mrs. Suom P. was born in 1959 and has established a small family in the best territory, Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is married with five children. Three of the children are employed and two are enrolled in school. Suom P. has another partner in her husband who has learned how to build houses and has been using his knowledge to earn a living. Mrs Suom P. is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The approaching rainy season is good for planting. Suom P. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Mrs. Suom P. is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. (Mrs. Suom P.’s husband appears in the photo).

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 60-year-old married man who lives with his wife and child. Salim has owned a small chicken farm in Bint Jbeil since 1990 and he's proud and happy with what he's doing. It's his only source of income and he his doing his best to raise his chicks in a healthy medium to result in the best quality product. Salim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to pay for his child's school fees and stationery. Salim is working hard to provide a secure living and education for his family members and he hopes to expand his business to a bigger farm in the near future.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school expenses and stationery

loans.name: Remigia

texts.en:
Remigia is a member of the Communal Bank group "Active Women II" located in the district of Juliaca, the province of San Román, and the department of Puno. She is 51 years old and married with four children (three of whom are independent). She studied until the fifth year of primary school.

Remigia has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, to increase the capital for her sound system rental business. 

She is now asking for a loan of 800 PEN, to buy construction materials for her hardware store and for her sound system rental business.  

Her dream is to expand her hardware store and to have more equipment. 	

Her favorite thing about the Communal Bank is its monthly meetings, because it is a distraction and the good exchange of words between the bank's members.

loans.use: The purchase of additional construction materials for her business renting out sound equipment

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre María Auxiliadora, se conformó en fecha 03 de agosto del 2006, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Ma. Ana A., quien se dedica a la venta de gallinas, logró  contactar con la asesora en la oficina Regional de Itá, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
 Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 12º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Durante todo el transcurso de estos ciclos han tenido algunos inconvenientes con algunas compañeras y tuvieron algunos problemas de pago, que gracias a la nueva modalidad de pago que ofrece el programa han superado los inconvenientes y están demostrando  un excelente cumplimiento de pago.
 Las mismas gracias al apoyo crediticio recibido con este programa han logrado sobresalir  en cada una de sus actividades, han demostrado una vez más que las mujeres son pilares esenciales dentro de una familia y que las mismas también pueden superarse cada día más.
La señora Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora  y quiere continuar con la cría y venta de gallinas. 
A ella le conviene mucho esta actividad ya que le genera buena ganancia y semanalmente obtiene buenos ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de  bebederos, balanceados para alimentos de los animales y otros.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Women's Committee was set up on the 3rd of August 2006 when the current managing director Mrs María Ana A., who has a business selling chickens, contacted the advisor in the regional office in Itá to find out how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) works.

Once she had been advised about how the program works, she got together 16 women who are now working very happily together on their 12th loan cycle as a united and supportive group within the program.  Over the course of all these loan cycles they have faced a number of problems with some of their fellow members and had some difficulties meeting their repayments but, thanks to the new payment method which the program now offers, they have managed to overcome their difficulties and are showing an excellent repayment performance.

The members of the group are grateful for the support of the loans they have received from this program which have enabled them to succeed in each one of their business activities.  They have showed once again that women are essential pillars within the family and that they can better themselves every day.

María is a very enterprising woman and she would like to continue raising and selling chickens.  The work really suits her as it generates a good income and she obtains good profits weekly.

She is requesting this loan to buy, amongst other things, water troughs and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: To buy water troughs, balanced animal feed, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en campiña Laynas, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Morropón y que se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Marina cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de los pobladores de la zona ya que se encuentra ubicada lejos del centro de la ciudad por ser zona rural. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Ella desea adquirir mas productos para ampliar su negocio con motivo de la cercanía de las fiestas navideñas ya que durante esta temporada la demanda por sus productos aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Marina, 44, is married and lives with her family in Laynas, a rural area of La Matanza district that is part of Morropón district in Piura region over two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

Marina has a small grocery store installed in her home where she stocks various daily consumption items among which are first need items and groceries.  Her business is well received by residents in the area because it is far from city center since it’s a rural zone.  Income from this activity helps her husband support the family economy.

She wants to acquire more products to widen her stock because of the approaching 
Christmas season which is when demand for products increases.  She has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y sus dos menores hijos en el sector Capote del distrito de Picsi, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de salir adelante a pesar de las limitaciones económicas de su familia, le llevó a trabajar como obrero de construcción hace 20 años. Durante todo este tiempo esta actividad ha sido su principal fuente de sustento y le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. Poco a poco se ha ido haciendo conocido en el medio y ahora su trabajo es valorado por la responsabilidad y eficacia con la que es realizado.

Debido a la alta demanda en la zona ha instalado también un negocio de elaboración de adobes y ladrillos el cual le está ayudando a agenciarse de ingresos adicionales. Actualmente el desea adquirir material para ampliar su negocio y así aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Miguel ya ha tenido un crédito anterior financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad pudo adquirir herramientas para poder mejorar sus trabajos como obrero constructor. Por ello el se encuentra agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 44 year-old father who lives with his wife and two dependent children in Capote sector of Picsi district, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

The need to get ahead in spite of his family's financial limitations, led Miguel to start work as a builder 20 years ago.  For the last 20 years, this has been Miguel's main source of support and it has helped him to get his family ahead in life.  He has gradually become known in the trade and now his work is valued for the responsibility and efficiency with which it is carried out.

Owing to the high demand in his area, he also set up a business making unbaked bricks and regular bricks.  This is helping him to make additional income.  Currently he would like to buy material to expand his business and thereby improve his sales.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Miguel has already had a Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa and our seed money product.  He used that money to acquire tools to improve his work as a builder.  He is very grateful to the people who supported him.

loans.use: To buy material to expand his business making and selling unbaked bricks and regular bricks

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; ella tiene 37 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de venta de pan, la socia elabora pan y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de Urcos, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como harina,manteca,azúcar entre otros mas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank.  The bank is located in Urcos District, which belongs to Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Ms. Maritza.  She is 37 years old, lives with her partner and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her bread-selling business.  She makes bread and sells it as a traveling saleswoman in the plaza at Urcos.  She has had this business for several years, and she is happy because she can make ends meet for her family.

Maritza is asking for the loan so she can buy supplies like flour, lard, sugar and other items for her business.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: Buy supplies such as flour, lard, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Tuya, 37 years old, is married and has three children who all attend a high school in town. Tuya and her family live in their own house and yard in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband was previously a driver, but he is now not working. Tuya has been operating a towel-selling business since 2008. She has also started to sell underwear. She and her husband are planning to operate furniture-making business and to buy tools and to do repairs. Tuya is a handy person. She requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase more goods to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more goods.

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia V. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a food stall (eatery), a general store and a ready-to-wear clothes business.  

She lives in Tak-an, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her food stall, general store and ready-to-wear clothes businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.  

Anecia is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can buy rice and spices for her eatery and stocks for the general store. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Anecia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of the food stall business

loans.name: Elizabeth Ampong

texts.en:
Elizabeth Ampong E. sells salted dried fish, onions, ripe plantain and other items as a peddler in Dompoase near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is single and takes care of 4 children. She has attained a senior high school level of education. 

From the proceeds of her business, Elizabeth provides her family with basic needs. She is asking for a loan to invest into her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest it back into her business. 

In this picture Elizabeth is cutting the dried salted fish into pieces to be sold.

loans.use: To invest in food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en:
Togtohbayar, 27, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent) in his father's backyard. 

In 2008, Togtohbayar began selling foodstuffs with his wife. They own a container, which is located at a local market where they operate their business. Togtohbayar's current working capital is 2,650,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT). They purchase the food for their business from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. 

Togtohbayar wants to expand his business and operate a wholesale food trading center. He is a hardworking and sociable person who says, " I want to have my own land and house in the future after I expand my business." 

Togtohbayar is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik to purchase food supplies such as candies, biscuits, rice, noodles, and sugar for his business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs such as candies, biscuits, rice, noodles, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Los Hermanos Unidos 1 Group

texts.en:
Faviela is the coordinator of her group Los Hermanos Unidos 1 (United Brethren 1). Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industry. The town’s main economic activity revolves around a free traD. zone, a cement factory and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Faviela makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her little son. She says that her greatest challenge is caring for her family, yet she hopes to have more children in the future.

Faviela operates a fruit stall. She has been in business for almost three years, a venture she started with money she received from her first loan. She enjoys doing business. It is her favorite pastime because she makes money doing this. She is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her prior loans and grown her business. Faviela plans to use this loan to invest further in her business. She will use her profits to increase her sales and to continue growing her business.

Faviela is saving to make her dreams come true: to have a prosperous life, a safe and beautiful home, and more children. She knows this will be possible through God’s will.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her stall

loans.name: Letty Mariana Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi ciudad con una rica cultura prehistórica, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

La señora Letty es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito y porque aquí ha hecho más amigas. Tiene 41 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación  tiene dos hijos de 25 y 17 años, él menor vive con ella y estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella tiene un comedor en el sector donde vive, trabaja de viernes a domingo desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00, prepara el delicioso encebollado de pescado que es un plato muy solicitado por los habitantes del sector y de la provincia, su hijo le ayuda cuando tiene tiempo libre. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio 12 años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que según ella nadie prepara el encebollado más rico que ella.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca, sodas, chifles y otros productos necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos.

Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y que su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The village bank Los Corrales meets every 15 days in a place called Los Corrales, a few minutes from Montecristi, a city with a rich prehistoric culture. Here, the majority of residents have different economic activities such as artisan crafts and general commerce.

Letty is a founding member of the village bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions and because she has made many friends here. She is 41 years old, married and has two children, 25 and 17 years old. The youngest lives with her and is in high school. Her husband is a mason.

She has a restaurant in the area where she lives. She works Friday to Sunday from 8:00am to 3:00pm making encebollado de pescado [a traditional Ecuadorian fish stew], which is a plate that is very popular with the local inhabitants. Her son helps when he has free time. She tells us that she has had this business for 12 years and that it has always gone very well, since according to her no-one makes encebollado better than she does. 

The loan is to buy fish, yucca, sodas, plantain chips and other products necessary to prepare the meals.

Her dreams are to have a bigger restaurant and that her son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy fish, yucca, sodas, plantain chips and other ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. Nazgul is 32 and married to a taxi driver. They have a daughter and two sons; the first son is at school and the other children are of preschool age (under seven). In order to make money to cover family expenses, the family cultivates agricultural products. They also breed livestock and then sell them at a higher price after fattening. Nazgul hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase barley seeds. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase barley seeds.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh T. L., 32, has two children who are in high school, and is living in Yen phong district. Being a farmer, she sees that the income from agricultural activity is not enough to cover all her family expenditure. In 2006, she decided to open a shop that sells CDs, records, mobiL. phones and phone cards. Her shop was much developed when she accessed our loan in 2009. Since that time, she has passed five loan cycles successfully. For the new loan cycL., she requires a loan of 9,184,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more new design mobiL. phones to attract customers.

Lien T. N. is 25 years old with a child. She has a shop that sells cosmetic products at her house. Now she needs a loan of 7,392,000 Vietnamese dong

Huong T. T. is 23 years old with a child. She has a shop that sells electrical devices and water equipment. She needs to have a loan 5,152,000 Vietnamese dong.

loans.use: to buy more new design mobile phones to attract customers.

loans.name: 7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hằng, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, is the leader of a four-member group, the 9.1.7 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

For five years, Hằng has had a business making iron furniture. One of the most critical business difficulties she faces is the lack of capital, so she is requesting her first loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase steel and iron for her enterprise. With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase steel and iron.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 38 years old and married with two children in school. For the past four years, she has run a mobile-phone money transfer business. Ann also owns rental houses which generate additional income.  

Ann is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to purchase items for her business. She says that through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business. In the future, Ann hopes to build apartments to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy items for her mobile phone business

loans.name: Victor Julio

texts.es:
Victor Julio tiene 23 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofía, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Victor se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz, frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es contruir la casa.

Le gusta estar con la familia y hacer deporte con ellos.
texts.en:
Victor Julio is 23 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. 
His area is called October 27th. It is located in Recinto San Sofia, which belongs to the Ventanas Canton. This area is dedicated to rural agricultural. In the short growing season they grow corn, rice and beans. 
Victor works in agriculture, cultivating corn, rice and beans. Each month he buys his supplies in Ventanas and he sells his goods in the market of the same town.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost. With the support of this loan, he will be able to buy the supplies that he needs. His dream is to buy his own house.
He likes to be with his family and play sports with them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Gbevivi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEVIVI est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Nadège est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nadège a 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Nadège est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Hypolite .Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Aucun des enfants ne vit avec elle. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Nadège mène comme activité depuis deux ans la vente de légumes. Nadège s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Nadège sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEVIVI un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The GBEVIVI group is composed of four women that live in the same house in Benin. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDE in order to increase their activity level. Nadège is the 26 year old representative of the group, and is the woman holding her hand up in the photo. 
She is married to a tailor named Hypolite. The couple have two educated children, neither of which live with them. In order to address their needs, Nadège has been selling vegetables for the past two years, and stocks up at one of the biggest markets in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales, Nadège is asking for a first loan along with the other members of the GBEVIVI group.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a 54-year-old man who is married and has one daughter and three sons. He has a public transportation taxi and work as a driver. It is the only source for generating income for the family. Because Ahmed doesn't have enough cash money to repair his taxi, he needs a loan of $1,200. While Ahmed is getting FATEN's loan, which is repaid on monthly basis amount, it will able him to preserve the validity of the taxi, which means generating a better income.

loans.use: to cover taxi maintenance and regular checkup fees

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a hardworking 44-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with a 14-year-old child, who attends school. For the last 16 years, in order to provide for her family, she has been making juice to sell. In the next five years, she wants to have grown and expanded her business so that she is able to realize her dream of building her own house and owning her own company.
Ann is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy bottles and sugar flavors. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for educating her about proper financial management and enabling her to buy plots of land.

loans.use: to buy bottles and sugar flavors.

loans.name: Ihssan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. Ihssan has had a blacksmith and welding workshop since 2005. He is 22 years old, single and lives by himself. He has good experience in his field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Ihssan decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to buy a hydraulic pressure machine. He is aiming to gain more profits, so he can have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic pressure machine.

loans.name: Ruby Ester

texts.es:
Ruby está feliz con su anterior credikiva, porque gracias a este pudo aumentar sus ventas de bolsos, hamacas y mochilas en la Zona Turistica de Tolú; en la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará hilos, y artesanias para continuar su distribución de productos y aumentar su capital de trabajo, porque su sueño es tener un almacen bien posicionado en la carretera Troncal del Occidente que es la zona comercaial de San Jacinto. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Ruby ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/204874
texts.en:
Ruby is happy with her previous Kiva loan because she was able to increase her sales of handbags, hammocks, and backpacks in the tourist district of Tolú. She is now applying for a new Kiva loan so that she can buy yarn and handicrafts in order to continue distributing her products and increase her operating capital. Her dream is to open a warehouse in a good location along the Troncal del Occidente Highway, which is in the commercial district of San Jacinto.

To learn more about Ruby’s story, please follow the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/204874

loans.use: to buy yarn and handicrafts.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, 52 years old, is a fish seller with her husband. Their income is $7 per day. The couple has six children. Two children are studying and the other two are working, and the $7 per day provides for them for all. Every month, Mao has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 buy a motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service. She has been selling fish for almost 10 years and most of the villagers are her customers. She hopes that her husband's new career will help her family to gain more income, so that this couple will be able to send the rest of their children to study at a higher level.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband so he can start a motorbike taxi service

loans.name: Cinthia Nohemy

texts.es:
La joven Cinthia es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la aldea Los Llanitos de Marcovia,  junto a la ella vive su esposo y su pequeña hija, Cinthia es muy dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de confites, paletas, bombones y otros productos relacionados con los confites, tiene 5 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad, Cinthia se caracteriza por ser responsable y honrada, trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a su hija.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de confites, las ganancias las utilizara para el sustento de su hija.
su meta es darle una buena educacion a su hija.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a  hardworking young woman. She lives in the town of Los Llanitos de Marcovia with her husband and her young daughter. She is very dedicated to her retail business in candies, popsicles, bonbons, and other sweets, which she has operated for five years. Cinthia considers herself to be responsible and trustworthy and works very hard to provide a better life for her daughter. 

She will use this loan to buy candies for sale, the profits of which will go to support her daughter. Her goal is to provide a good education to her daughter.

loans.use: to buy candies for sale.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi, 59 years old, is a motor taxi driver earning $7 per day. His wife is staying home. They live together with one child, who is 8 years old and studying in school. Every month, Yi has to spend $50 on food, $8 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a new motorbike for his work because his current motorbike has no taxation (mean he bought it with no tax certificate that make the price low) so he can’t take customers to town otherwise he will need to pay for the tax certificate. Yi wants to support his child to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his work.

loans.name: Mutiru

texts.en:
Mutiru is a 43-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 16 years to 20 years. She describes herself as social. She operates a tailoring services business where she makes and sells dresses, shirts, trousers and others. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre at Mwingi. 

Mutiru describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stock of materials. Her business goal is to grow her business into a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide university education for her children.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Mamlakatjon

texts.ru: Мамлакатджон вдова и у него двое детей. Она умная и целеустремленная женщина. Чтобы содержать свою семью и обеспечить своих детей она начала заниматься купля продажей женских одежд 16 лет назад. В этом бизнесе она имеет богатый опыт и успешно продолжает. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль для того чтобы устроит свадьбу внука. Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки нового ассортимента женских одежд с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mamlakatjon is a widow with two children.  She is a smart and goal-oriented woman. In order to support her family and provide for her children, 16 years ago she started buying and reselling women’s clothing. She has a lot of experience in this business and continues doing it successfully. She would like to expand her business and maximize her profit in order to pay for her grandson’s wedding. She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 3000 TJS in order to buy a new assortment of women’s clothing and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy goods [women's clothing]

loans.name: Siritanyi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sitirira Group in Western Kenya! Isaac is the facilitator of the Sitirira group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Isaac takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Isaac had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Isaac was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isaac and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Isaac will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sitirira group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Isaac is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Victoria nació en la ciudad de Casca y tiene 48 años de edad, ella trabaja elaborando tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chulos y chalinas de lana de alpaca y de oveja. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Victoria también se dedica a la venta de fruta de forma ambulatoria.  

Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo frutas y lana de alpaca. 
 
Victoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Las Palmeras" of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco. Victoria was born in the city of Casca and is 48 years old. She works with fabrics making garments such as sweaters, chulos (an Andean style of hat with earflaps) and scarves made from alpaca and sheep's wool. She has been doing this for several years and she is doing well. Victoria also sells fruit as a street vendor.

Victoria needs the loan to buy merchandise such as fruit and alpaca wool.

Victoria is grateful for the opportunity afforded her by this means and likewise agrees to abide with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as fruit and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, who lives in Changamwe, Mombasa, owns a butchery which has been in existence for five years and employs two other people. He also drives a public transport vehicle. He is married and has two children, neither of whom is in school.

Josphat is requesting a loan of ksh 40,000 to help him purchase more cattle for slaughter. His main challenge is the periodic scarcity of cattle, which drives prices up. Josphat states that the additional income arising from the loan will help him meet the family's daily requirements and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Batanai Group

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Danai from Harare. She is divorced with three children, all attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Danai runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are customs duties and competition. 

Danai has requested a loan of $400 to add a stock of fashionable clothes to cater to different age groups. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family as well as pay school fees on time for her children. In the future, Danai plans to have a variety of goods ranging from school uniforms to casual wear.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi  is a peddler in cloth and scarfs at Ankuanda near Elmina. 

She is matrimonially joined to a farmer and they have two children. She supports her partner in the payment of accommodation and utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy more of the cloth and scarfs for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: buy more of the cloth and scarfs.

loans.name: Julienne Sèmako

texts.fr: Julienne Sèmako est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Julienne Sèmako a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Julienne Sèmako est mariée à un certain Désiré. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Julienne Sèmako exerce depuis quinze ans le métier de coiffure dans son atelier située à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Julienne Sèmako vend des mèches, de charbon de bois et de l’huile de palme. Julienne Sèmako achète ses produits au Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Julienne Sèmako contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Julienne Sèmako sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Julienne Sèmako a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Julienne Sèmako is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at the secondary level. She is married to a man named Désiré. They have one child who is in school and in their care. In addition to their child, they have two other children to support. The children live together with their parents. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To help meet the various needs of the family,  Julienne Sèmako has been working in the hairdressing trade for fifteen years in her salon in her home. On the side, she sells hair extensions, charcoal, and palm oil. She purchases her supplies in Benin. Thanks to the revenues that her business generates, she is helping with the different family expenses. 

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base,  Julienne Sèmako is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a second time. The previously loan obtained by  Julienne Sèmako was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and othe products (palm oil, charcoal).

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 46, a resident of Manila and the mother of two children. Together with her children she manages the household while operating her business. She continually works hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Myrna operates a sari-sari adjacent to her house. In the Philippines a sari-sari is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s worth of cooking oil or an egg.

Myrna profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Myrna is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using it to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory, which she expects will boost her business.

Myrna dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and study the Word of God from which she draws strength and inspiration.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María Concepción tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijas y un hijo, reside en la Aldea San Nicolás. Doña María inició vendiendo nacatamales y ropa de segunda mano, y desde hace algunos años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de rosquillas y quesadillas, ella también tiene venta de abarrotería en general. Ella se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para iniciar su jornada laboral, desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm, dos de sus hijas le ayudan atender la pulpería mientras ella se dedica a la elaboración del horneado de rosquillas y quesadillas. Por la venta de su producto obtiene una buena ganancia pero cuando llueve mucho le va mal porque la leña se moja y no le da buen punto al pan y este se pasa de tiempo, en la pulpería le va muy bien ya que no tiene mucha competencia y le deja buenas ganancias. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, huevos, productos lácteos, manteca, plátanos, frijoles, leña, etc. Y con lo que venda ella podrá seguir sosteniendo a su familia y también podrá ahorrar un poco para responder ante cualquier emergencia. Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijas para que cada una de ellas tenga su propio negocio y puedan ganarse la vida honradamente. María Concepción ha sido cliente de FAMA por mas de nueve ciclos y ha sido una cliente que ha pagado sus cuotas puntualmente.

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 41-year-old single woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as determined and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She identifies lack of funds as her biggest business challenge. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes a 52 year old mother has a very clear, ambitious plan for her economic activity - farming. She owns a small plot of land in Nyamokeri village where she resides with her husband and eight children. On her farm, she grows maize and bananas and she raises cattle and poultry that provide him with milk and eggs both for her family's consumption and sales. She has been a mixed farmer for 5 years but that is not all that she is doing.

Agnes is seeking a KES 40,000 loan to purchase poultry. The brood of hens will lay more eggs that will bring in more profits once they are sold. Some of the eggs will be hatched to increase the number of chickens in the farm. This loan will mean the world to Agnes. When she was asked what makes him enjoy farming, she replied, "My work is the backbone of my family because it gives me and my family income." Her biggest challenges are lack of inputs. Your loan will help Agnes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on stock

loans.name: Antoinnette

texts.en:
Born in 1966, S. Antoinette is a woman full of initiative who wishes to become self-sufficient and detach herself from the burden of her husband. She cares for six (06) people, including an uncle and her mother. Her husband is a craft worker who has almost no clients left, he then has no income to provide for the family’s needs. The income derived from the wife’s business of palm nut biomass is invested to cover the family’s needs consequently she does not have the capacity to auto-finance. She is soliciting a loan of $400 for start up capital to purchase palm nut biomass so she can efficiently turn a profit in this activity. She knows that business well and could provide properly for her children’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1966, S. Antoinette est une femme pleine d’initiative qui souhaite s’auto suffire et se détacher du poids de son mari. Elle a six (06) personnes à charge dont un oncle et sa mère. Son mari est artisan et n’a pratiquement plus de clientèle ce qui fait qu'il n'a plus de revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Les revenus du commerce des débris de noix de palme de la femme est investi dans les besoins de la famille si bien qu’elle ne détient plus aucune capacité d’autofinancement. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $400 en guise de fonds de commerce pour acheter des débris de noix de palme afin de pouvoir rentabiliser effectivement cette activité qu'elle maîtrise bien et subvenir convenablement aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use:
Purchase of palm nut biomass (alternative fuel energy)

Achat de débris de noix de palme

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en:
Bertha has run her grocery store for a year and a half. "I run my business from inside my home. I have worked hard to get it. I'm a widow and my children help me run it since it's our only means of income. I would like to buy more merchandise to increase sales. I'm asking for $1,000 to invest into my business."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Bertha tiene 1 año y medio con su negocio “Mi negocio lo tengo dentro de mi casa, he trabajado mucho para tenerlo soy viuda y mis hijos me ayudan para atenderlo ya que son los únicos ingresos que tenemos me gustaría poder comprar más mercancía y tener más ventas”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la inversión.

loans.use: Invest in her grocery store; buy more supplies to increase sales.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya V. is a single, divorced mother of one daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye and runs a business selling spices, plastic dishes and various home and kitchen gadgets. This is actually her second business. In her original store she sells different teas but decided to broaden her investments with a second store. The two stores are located right next to each other making it convenient for her to efficiently run both stores herself.

Natalya has been in the same location for 13 years and has an extensive background in managerial work. She is a very lively woman, friendly, out-going, dependable and is a great entrepreneur. Natalya’s goal is to eventually open another store in a different location which would greatly enhance her sales and income. She just recently became a grandmother (which she is thrilled about) and has had her daughter and family move in with her. Her desire is to see her business develop and prosper so that she can help both families. She makes about $400 to $500 a month and has around $800 to $1,000 invested in her products. She has requested a $1000 loan in order to purchase more inventories. In all the years she has been associated with Nadiya Ukraine she has never been late with a loan payment.

loans.use: Natalya would like to purchase additional inventory for her kitchen and home supply store.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir A. B. is a 28-year-old woman living in Sharoun with her family. She learned embroidery on an instrument called 'A. nol' in 2005 and started selling her work one year later. She does also crochet which she learned from her mother at 13 years old. Nadine is a very talented and committed girl who sells her work to a workshop in Aley, and to neighbors in the surrounding villages. Nadine would like to borrow $300 to buy the required materiA. for her embroidery work. "My work is what allows me to be financially independent. My independence being the most important thing for me."

Abir is part of a group with other women from the same village. Her group name is 'A. Wouroud' which means roses. The group loan is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending is based on incrementA. increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: To buy the necessary material for the embroidery work

loans.name: Edis Consuelo

texts.es:
My name is Edis R., and I run a small grocery store in the center of my community called the “Pulperia R.”. I have been running the business for one year, and it has generated income to help cover my living expenses. I am looking to further supply my business to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Edis R., cuento con una pulperia ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, operando bajo el nombre de Pulperia R., tengo un año de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder satifacer la demanda de cliente.

loans.use: Purchase additional products (such as bread, coffee, sugar, beverages, rice, etc.) to sell in small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise such as household items and beds.

loans.name: Kasi Mpya A Group

texts.en:
Salma, age 35, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 3). She owns a grocery store, which she began 4 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 11pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of about $140.

In the past, Salma took out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She now hopes for a new loan to start a water business and chicken business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in selling various foods, clothes, and charcoal.

In the picture, Salma is in the front row, third from the left.

loans.use: To start two additional businesses

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
When Gabriela got married, she hadn't yet finished her studies to become an accountant. This is why she started a grocery store in 2001 to earn extra money to pay her home's expenses. What her husband earns as an electrician isn't enough to pay their home's expenses or those of their son who was just born.

Gabriela now has more clients who come to her to buy merchandise. In addition, several neighbors come to her so she can do the accounting for their businesses, and she earns a little more money this way. Nevertheless, Gabriela hopes to grow her business, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $475, which she is willing to repay in 5 months. With this money, Gabriela will be able to buy more merchandise like fruits and vegetables to grow her business. With your help, Gabriela will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cuando se casó Gabriela todavía no había terminado su carrera de Contador. Y fue por eso que en el 2001 comenzó con un negocio de abarrotes para poder sacar dinero extra para pagar los gastos de la casa. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo como electricista no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de su casa y tampoco los de su hijo que acaba de nacer.

Gabriela Actualmente ya cuenta con más clientes que la buscan para comprarle mercancía. Además de que les lleva la contabilidad a varios vecinos de sus negocio y con esto saca un poco más de dinero. Sin embargo Gabriela desea establecer más su negocio es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Y con este dinero Gabriela podrá comprar más mercancía como frutas y verduras para poder consolidar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Gabriela podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Jenesta

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 44 year-old Jenesta B., who is married with four children, aged between 16 and 23.

In 1999, Jenesta established a livestock business. She has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan of $525 to purchase additional chicks and calves to raise and sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $260. In the future, Jenesta also plans to diversify her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and calves for her livestock business.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 59-years-old and is married with one child who is 34-years-old. She and her husband also take care of a 15-year-old child. Basilia has owned a car since 2004 and uses it to transport people and goods. She works from 7AM to 8:30PM and earns a monthly profit of approximately $190.

Basilia has taken out one successful loan to help her business. She is requesting another loan to repair her car for her business.

loans.use: To repair car for transporting people and goods

loans.name: Heidi

texts.es:
Heidi M. is from the district of Cinco Pinos in Cinandega and sells various types of products in her own grocery store in her home. With much effort she has been able to get ahead because she is very dedicated to her business and has been able to meet the needs of her household.

Now the problem that she is facing is the lack of financing to purchase merchandise from suppliers and for this reason she is asking for a loan through Ceprodel to invest in her business by purchasing more products. It is very important to emphasize that when she has the merchandise she will have no problem selling it in her neighborhood and will thus be able to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Heidi M. es una dama originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega el cual se dedica a la labor de la venta de diferentes tipos de productos teniendo su propia pulpería en su localidad de habitación. Con mucho s esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante ya que ha brindado gran dedicación a su negocio y por este motivo ha logrado suplir las necesidades de su hogar de habitación.

Hoy en día la problemática que esta dama atraviesa es la ausencia del recurso económico para la compra de la mercadería a los proveedores y es por este motivo que solicita préstamo en Ceprodel para invertir en su negocio por medio de la compra de los productos. Es de suma importancia destacar que al adquirir la mercadería puede comercializarla sin ningún problema en su sector de habitación dando lugar al mejoramiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of articles to expand her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur who lives in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine, where she sells jeans at a kiosk at the central market. She is married and has one son. Tatyana started her business 13 years ago, and has acquired lots of experience selling merchandise in different price ranges. Through her determination and hard work, Tatyana has built a loyal customer base and makes a stable profit of around $600 per month.

Tatyana has asked for a loan of $525 to help increase her working capital and buy additional merchandise to sell during the summer season. The new selections will help her satisfy her customers' needs, boost her sales and provide a better living for her family.

(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: Increase her capital and buy additional inventory

loans.name: Mwalimu Suza

texts.en: Suza Mwalimu is 24 years old, the mother of two children and a resident of the Chanika neighborhood of Dar es Salaam. She makes a living running a shop where she sells used clothes, a business she has been in for the past four years. Her income has helped her look after her family and relatives. She needs a loan to buy more inventory to sell and to expand her business

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her clothing shop

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a married mom of a 12-year-old. Her family lives in Vinogradovo, Transcarpathian region. Nataliya owns a small grocery store and doesn’t face much competition from other store vendors as there are none in her neighborhood. This aspect has become one of the decisive factors of her success. Partnership with Nadiya Ukraine and financial assistance she had received from the organization has become another strong benefit on Nataliya’s way to expansion of her trade.

Nataliya has been in business for eight years. Presently, she has about $5000 in merchandise and get about $1000 in income. Her business is characterized by sustainability and consistent growth. However, Nataliya doesn’t want to stop where she is at. She would like to keep her business running and developing. Nataliya realizes groceries will always be in demand, plus this type of inventory doesn’t depend on seasonal changes which is why she looks into her entrepreneurial future with great optimism. She is requesting a 4000 Grivna loan to increase assorted merchandise and her income as a result.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chen Y. is a 26-year-old farmer, earning about US$ 1 per day, while her husband, Mr. Yon Nann, also 26 years old, is a fisherman. He has been fishing since 2003 in Tunle Sap Lake and can earn US$ 2 per day, and fishing is also the main source of income for the family. Chen and her husband live with four children in Koktlok Le Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Because of the growing fishing business of her husband, Chen is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 550 for her husband to purchase fishing implements. This loan will help to expand her husband's business, so it will improve their family's income. Chen's husband is pictured because Chen was unvailable.

loans.use: For her husband to purchase fishing implements

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil A. is a 19 year old trader who sells men's clothes. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his large family consisting of his elderly parents and two older brothers who are studying at school. 

Adil has a trading place in the central local market in the city of Sabirabad. All of the fabric is bought from the neighboring town of Baku, the capital of country. Adil is trying to have a wide range of goods to better meet the requirements and different levels of income of his customers. 

Today, Adil feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of $1000 USD. He believes that this loan will improve not only his business, but also his family's living standards. Let's help this incredible young man give his family a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.ru: Хамзаева Гулсанам жительница города Вахдат.Возраст 30 лет, незамужем,образлвание среднее.Клиентка имеет небольшую столовую на рынке  района Вахдат. В данный момент она хочет  закупить больше  овощей,масла и муки. Расширив бизнес,она сможет получать больше дохода.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 3 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulsanam H. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 30 years old, unmarried, and has a secondary education. This entrepreneur has a small cafeteria in the Vahdat district market. She wants to buy more vegetables, oil, and flour. Expanding her business will increase her profits. The loan will be repaid over three months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foods for cafeteria

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S., 48, is married and resides with her seven children and husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Working as a village doctor together with her husband, Khem Kuy, 56, typically makes US$3 each day. Her family is also supported by four of the children who work growing rice. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. Sor S. is asking for a loan of US$150 to purchase more medicines.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda es casada, vive con su esposo y con uno D. sus hijos. Hace más D. un año, esta madre, le dio la mejor solución a los bajos ingresos económicos en su hogar por medio D. la elaboración D. bocaditos artesanales como maní confitado y habitas saladas, D. esta manera produce preferentemente todas las noches en su casa para salir por las mañanas a repartir a las principales tiendas cercanas, también reparte a las  escuelas, colegios y hospitales, ella disfruta D. realizar esta actividad, es por ello que Doña Magda está planeando expandir su negocio, motivada diariamente por sus deseos D. seguir adelante y apoyar al último D. sus hijos con sus estudios. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, anteriormente participó en un banco comunal que cerró hace varios años atrás, por lo decidió abrir otro con sus vecinas. Con la cantidad que solicita podrá invertir en la compra D. habas y maní por sacos, a demás comprar un saco D. azúcar y un balD. granD. D. aceite, para abastecerse por un buen tiempo D. los ingredientes que usa, sin perjudicarse por el alza D. precios constante D. los productos.
texts.en:
Magda is married, lives with her husband and one of their children. More than a year ago, this mother and house maker found a solution to supplement the family's low income: preparing and selling snacks like candied peanuts and salted fava beans. Magda cooks preferably in the evenings and goes out every morning distributing her snacks to small grocery stores, and offers them in schools and hospitals. She really enjoys this activity and is planning on expanding her business, motivated by her wish for a better life and to help the last of her children finish his education. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. Before that she participated in a communal bank that closed years ago, so she decided to open another with her neighbors. The loan will be used to purchase sacks of fava beans and peanuts, as well a a sack of sugar and a large oil can. Having a large amount of ingredients will allow her not to be held back by the constant price increases.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: M. Steven is a determined and hardworking business man in Kaboyo-Rubindi.  He sells water heaters, taps and pipes.  This loan will help him replenish his stock by purchasing more taps and water heaters.  He is 50 years old and married with six children.  Steven’s dream is to open up a hardware shop in his community.  He also desires to see all his children finish school successfully.

loans.use: Purchasing more taps and water heaters.

loans.name: Hiem

texts.en: Mrs. Hiem N. is a farmer from Batheay village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 55 year old widow with two children, one of whom is a sculptor while the other is attending a local school. Mrs. N. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces problems because she does not have enough money to: a) buy rice seeds; b) hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field; and c) buy a pump machine in order to water the field. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to assist her with these tasks. She hopes that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy services and materials to cultivate rice

loans.name: Dagnaguénewendé

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de zanguera, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle fait cette activité depuis 1998 et fait ce commerce au marché local d’adidogomé, elle a déjà obtenu de wages un crédit de 300000f qu’elle a déjà remboursé c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse de nouveau à wages pour obtenir un crédit en vue d’acheter  des sacs de céréales. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Zanguera district. Her work income-generating work involves commerce in grains. She has been in this business since 1998 at the local marketplace of Adidogomé. She has already obtained from WAGES a loan of 300,000 francs, which she has already repaid. This is why she is again enquiring with WAGES to obtain a loan, for buying sacks of grain. She is married and the mother four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Hard Work Group

texts.en:
This is Kadie K., Aminata K. and Mabinty K.. They named their group "Hard Work."  They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have had meaningful effects in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now they are requesting a loan of Le 1,300,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Kadie K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is forty-five years of age. She was born in Makeni City. Her husband is a welder and they have three children. One of their children is still in school and the older two have already graduated from college. Kadie has been a businesswoman for over ten years.
 
Kadie sells cooked rice and toys. She will use this new loan to expand her business by buying two bags of rice and two barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil. She will use these for her cooked-rice business. She will invest the  balance of the loan in her toy business. A bag of rice costs Le 90,000 and a barter of palm-oil costs Le 60,000. 

Kadie is a skilled and experienced businesswoman. At first, she was selling only cooked rice. Because of a drop in sales, she started selling toys – the first person to start a toy business in her neighborhood. Many of her neighbors then also began selling toys. Kadie therefore made a slight change in the toy business just to continue to maintain a competitive edge.

loans.use: Tp buy two bags of rice and two barters of palm-oil

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle B. is 24 years old and manages a small sari-sari store (community based store) business in their village.  Since her income is insufficient to meet the needs of their family, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to further expand her business. She hopes that her loan request will be approved, and she promises to use it wisely for her business improvement and family development. 

Michelle is married to Voilie, a farmer, and they have a three-year-old son named Mark Gregorie. Though they belong to a poor family, she and her husband are working hard to have a progressive way of living.

loans.use: To expand her community store \

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a 66-year-old widow with one child. Despite her age, she is always busy in her vegetable garden, which is her major source of income. She plans to expand the gardening area with assorted vegetables. She asked for a loan of 11,000, to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her backyard garden project. Teresita has religiously paid her obligation to the coop since the start of her availment. She truly believes that through the help of Paglaum & KIVA she can access more capital for her project.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her gardening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy skirts and under skirts

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  María Magdalena P. C., Norma de la Cruz M. S. y Diomira Auxiliadora B. López.

El grupo solidario La Santiago es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, ellas por igual tienen sus actividades económicas y dependen solo de ellas, son bien conocidas por esta actividad en sus barrios.
Doña María Magdalena es la coordinadora del grupo, vende ropa variada, nueva y usada, como pantalones, camisas, fajas, etc. la eligieron coordinadora porque es comprometida con sus abonos y así anima a las miembros a no tener errores ni atrasos en sus pagos. Tiene cuatro hijos de edad escolar de  diez,doce, dieciséis y dieciocho  años, ellos van a la escuela mas cercana a la vivienda. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja en una empresa embotelladora y le da para el sustento, ella expresa que su negocio es de ella y compra lo que ella quiere para ella y sus hijos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Doña Diomira es una mujer mayor con una familia 2 hijos adolescentes, ellos estudian en la escuela del barrio, le ayudan en el negocio de la venta de medicina natural, su esposo trabaja de chofer de taxi y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, del negocio ella asume gastos extras del hogar como ropa de los hijos, cuadernos, etc. Su negocio le garantiza la alimentación del hogar y es por esto que ella es muy importante en las decisiones del hogar.

Doña Norma de la Cruz  se dedica a la venta de fritangas en su casa todas las noches, ofrece platos como : pollo asado, enchiladas, tacos, refrescos y helados. Es madre soltera con dos niñospequeños de tres años, vive con su mamá. Piensa trabajar para poder obtener sus propios electrodomésticos y así ser independiente.
texts.en:
Photos from the left to the right: Maria Magdalena P. C., Norma de la Cruz M. Dandigo and Diomira Auxiliadora B. Lopez. The group La Santiago is originally from the city of Masaya. Each of the women has her own work, and their respective businesses are well known in their neighborhoods. Dona Maria Magdalena coordinates the group, and she has a business selling new and used clothing such as pants, blouses, belts, etc. She was elected to lead the group because she complies with her payments and helps motivate the other members to make their payments on time. She has 4 children ages 10, 12, 16 and 18, who all attend school near their home. Her husband works in a bottling plant and helps with the household costs. She says that her business is her own, and she decides what to buy for herself and her children. She dreams of growing her business and being able to improve the quality of life for her family. Dona Diomira is an older woman with two adolescent children who study at the neighborhood school. They help her with her business selling natural medicines. Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps with the household costs. Through her business, she can cover the extra costs for the family such as clothing and school supplies. Her work and income guarantee that they all have enough food in the house, and for that reason she plays an important role in all household decisions. Dona Norma de la Cruz prepares food which she sells from her house every night, offering such dishes as roast chicken, enchiladas, tacos, soft drinks and ice creams. She is a single mother with 2 small children. Norma lives with her mother. She wants to continue her work so that she can afford her own appliances and be more independent.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for their respective businesses, including clothing, natural medicines, and food supplies.

loans.name: Yasmín Evelisa

texts.es: Yasmín Evelisa R. de 30 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colón junto a sus dos hijos y su madre. Ella posee un bazar en su propia casa, negocio el cual les ha permitido seguir adelante junto a su familia. Yasmín solicita un préstamo ya que necesita surtir su negocio comprando ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y otros productos más. Ella desea mucho aumentar sus ganancias ya que es la única que trabaja en su hogar, ya que su madre es de avanzada edad y contribuye cuidando a sus nietos, es por ello que Yasmín solicita dicho préstamo ya que desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yasmín Evelisa R. is 30 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón with her two children and her mother. She runs a store in her home that sells a variety of items. This business has allowed her and her family to keep moving forward.
Yasmín is requesting a loan because she needs to purchase clothing, cosmetics, perfume and other products to stock her business. She very much wishes to increase her earnings since she is the only one who works in her household now that her mother is older and helps by looking after her grandchildren.
This is why Yasmín is requesting this loan. She hopes to improve her business and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and clothing

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ingrid Selma

texts.es:
Ingrid Reinstch C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Miraflores, ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
La señora Ingrid es secretaria en una oficina privada,  ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia, ya que sus dos hijos están cursando los últimos semestres para culminar sus estudios.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de la instalación sanitaria y los muros interiores de su vivienda, que por el paso del tiempo sufrió un deterioro considerable.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ingrid Reinstch C. lives in her own home in the Miraflores Zone, beside the city of La Paz, with her son. Mrs. Ingrid is a secretary in a private office, income with which she uses to maintain her family. She has two children who are studying to finish school and are currently in their last semester. The loan requested is to renovate the plumbing and internal walls of her house, which over time have deteriorated considerably. This is the third time they have requested a loan, and a socioeconomic analysis carried out has qualified them favorably and thus they can access a loan.
