Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations

loans.name: Shalom Group 5

texts.en:
Wendi, pictured far left, is the group leader of the group Shalom. Wendi and her group live in the small town of Hato Mayor in the eastern province in the Dominican Republic.

Wendi has been selling pants and undergarments for five years. Two years into her business she decided to take out a small loan to help grow her business and she is now on her 7th loan cycle. Because she has never missed a payment, she is able to take out a bigger loan every time. With every loan she is able to increase her profits and put more money in her savings account. Wendi loves her job because she enjoys helping people find those ever-so-elusive perfect pair of jeans. 

Wendi has two children (ages 1 and  7) and her goal is to grow her business enough to help send her children to college. You can help Wendi achieve her dreams but supporting this loan!

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her clothing business.

loans.name: Pedro Electerio

texts.es: Pedro Electerio T. tiene 56 años. Su actividad económica es la crianza de pollos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta pequeña actividad dio inicio porque Pedro tenía ciertos ahorros y con su poca cantidad de dinero decide comprar 3 pollos. A pesar que solo compro pocos pudo empezar con ellos. Ya que este empieza hacer la mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Decide continuar con su negocio además tiene experiencia en la compra y venta de ganado y esto le ha favorecido pues le ha dado la experiencia que tiene hasta los momentos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de alimentos para pollos. El sueño de Pedro que su negocio logre aumentar lo suficiente.
texts.en:
Pedro Electerio T. is 56 years old. His economic activity is raising chicken. More than three years ago he started this small business. He had some savings and decided to buy three chickens with his small amount of money. Despite the reduced number of chickens, this was the beginning of an activity that has become the biggest source of income for his family and he decided to continue with it. Furthermore, he gained some experience in trading with cattle and so far this was useful.

Pedro applies for a loan to expand his working capital. He will buy chicken food. Pedro dreams to expand his business sufficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Four years ago, Bella started having her own business. She joined ASHI then to be able to loan for a business capital which she used for starting up her hog fattening business and to be able to finance her manicure and pedicure business which she learned when she was six years old. Having her own business, her husband's sporadic income being a farm laborer will be augmented to be able to meet the daily needs of their three children who were in school. Sometimes Bella sells food in their neighborhood for n additional income because profit from her businesses alone can not supply the increasing demand of her family. Her eldest child, 21 years old hadn't even graduated from high school and her second child, 19 years had only graduated from elementary. It was a many years ago that Bella's two elder children stopped from going to school. During those years, Bella was not yet a member of ASHI and didn't have her own business. Now, through she requests from ASHI, she will be able to enhance her businesses to be able to finance the education of her nine year old youngest child until graduation in college. 
Presently, Bella requests for a much larger loan to be used in growing her hog fattening business (pig raising) and to be able to purchase a manicuring set to be able to generate daily income. Hog fattening business grows fast given enough business capital since the profit from it is as much double the amount of it capital after four months of fattening the pigs. Selling hogs in larger volume would really generate bigger profit. This is what Bella looks for in every loan she requests.

loans.use: Will be used for financing a hog fattening (pig raising) and manicure/pedicure businesses.

loans.name: Marcializa

texts.en:
Marcializa A. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin. She is 32 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Marcializa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Marcializa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marcializa joined Kiva partner HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcializa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand the product offering. Marcializa is requesting a second loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Adela Gutiérrez de 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio La Esperanza de la capital de Managua, casada, tiene un hijo actualmente lo tiene estudiando, su esposo se desempeña como contador en una empresa privada le ayuda económicamente. Mujer emprendedora, trabajadora tiene su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos desde hace un año y medio, lo inicio con el objetivo que existiera otro ingreso en el hogar ya que como meta es la preparación intelectual de su hijo que le permitirá optar por un mejor futuro. Agradece a la Institución por el crédito, ya que será invertido en la elaboración de un closet teniendo una mayor comodidad, mantenerse en mejor estado los productos evitando perdidas y una presentación extendida de los productos el cual permitirá  a los clientes una mejor visión.
texts.en:
Señora Adela Gutiérrez is 40 years old and lives in the La Esperanza neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She is married, and has a son who is currently in school. Her husband works as an accountant for a private company. She is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has had her own business selling cosmetics for a year and a half. She started the business with the objective of bringing additional income into the home, to meet the goal of providing an education for her son that will allow him to have a better future. She is grateful to the institution for this loan, which will be invested in the construction of a closet which will allow her to live more comfortably, keep her products in better condition, and avoid losses. The closet will also allow for a better presentation of her business, permitting her customers to have an extended view of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials and wood to build a closet

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 46 years old. Leonida is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Hường Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117090081) is 32 years old.  She has 2 children who are going to school. She makes steamed rolls made of rice flour to sell. Her family life is difficult, so she wants to access loans to develop economically and so her family can enjoy a better life.

She has received loans from a Microfund organization for 4 years and repaid on time. She is a group leader. She has a monthly income of about 3,000.000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 5,450.000 VND (or 300 USD) to buy rice to make steamed rolls made of rice flour.

There are 4 other Fund participants in her group:

Nở Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117090082) is 39 years old. She is farming and breeding chickens. She wants to borrow 5,450.000 VND (or 300 USD) to buy more chickens to raise.

Quyết Thị Lê (id: 010117090084) is 32 years old. She wants to borrow 4,578.000 VND (or 250 USD) to breed poultry.

Nhàn Thị Nguyễn (id: 010117090083) is 38 years old. She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5,450.000 VND (or 300 USD) to invest in her shop.

Ninh Thị Đào (id: 010117090095) is 44 years old. She wants to borrow 3,706.000 VND (or 200 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To buy rice to make steamed rolls made of rice flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying piñatas

loans.name: María Milagros

texts.es:
La señora María Milagros T. R. es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y con deseos de seguir adelante. Ella tiene una pequeña miscelánea donde vende desde granos básicos, reposterías, refrescos, ropa, adornos hasta recargas y teléfonos.
Ella invertirá el préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería y nuevos productos de demanda.
texts.en:
Sra. María Milagros T. R. is a hardworking, enterprising woman who has the desire to succeed. She has a small general store where she sells basic grains, pastries, soft drinks, clothing, ornaments, mobile phones, and phone chargers.

She is requesting a loan so that she can acquire more merchandise and new products that are in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len C. is 43 years old and lives in the city of Phnom Penh.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 16 and 23.  Len is a housewife and her husband (pictured here) has been a fisherman since 1984.  He earns $2 a day by selling his catch to a local vendor who then resells the fish at a local market.  

The couple’s youngest child is in high school.  The three oldest children are employed as construction workers and in small shops.  They contribute to the family’s income and earn about $3 a day.  

Len requested her first loan of $1,000 from CREDIT MFI to purchase a boat for her husband.  This will enable him to fish in larger bodies of water.  He is currently limited to small ponds and streams.  She hopes this loan will help her husband’s business improve so they can invest more money in their child’s education.

loans.use: Purchasing a boat.

loans.name: Mario Anastacio

texts.es: El señor Mario Anastacio tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y un menor. El señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de carga pesada, con viajes a Costa Rica y Centroamérica. El señor dio inicio a este negocio hace 33 años, primeramente realizaba transportes con una camioneta, luego compro un camión, y después, con el tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro pudo hacerse de un furgón, que es el que actualmente posee. El señor está solicitando este crédito ya que piensa comprar dos llantas con sus neumáticos nº 120020, ya que el furgón las tiene estas llantas en muy mal estado. El mayor desafió que siempre ha tenido él como empresario ha sido la pérdida de su hija, la cual falleció hace ya varios años, sin embargo esto los ayudo a unificarse mas como familia. De allí nace que su mayor sueño siempre ha sido establecer una empresa familiar de transporte y que sus hijos puedan trabajar con el.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Anastacio is 53 years old, married, with 5 children. Four are of legal age and one is a minor. For a living he transports heavy loads to Costa Rica and Central America. He started his business 33 years ago, previously he transported with a pickup truck and later he bought a truck and with time and much effort he saved money and bought a boxcar which he presently uses. He is requesting a loan as he wants to buy two tires No. 120020 as the tires of the boxcar are in bad condition. The biggest challenge he has faced as a businessman, was the loss of his daughter who passed away several years ago. Nevertheless this has helped to unify his family. Therefore his dream is to establish a family transportation enterprise and that his children work with him.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, single, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different products such as Milo, shampoo, candies, noodles, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2007, Annabelle joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
En el municipio de Villanueva el señor Andrés D. se esfuerzo trabaja  como docente con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar y beneficiar a sus 4 hijos que dependen de el en edad escolar.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de útiles escolares  para sus hijos  ya que se avecina la época escolar y es de mucha importancia que sus hijos vayan a escuela para ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Villanueva, Señor Andrés D. works as a teacher in order to earn a living for his home and to benefit his 4 school-age children who depend on him. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of school supplies for his children, since the school term approaches and it is very important that his children go to school to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies for his children

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 50 años, vive con su amado esposo Rosalindo de 55 años, tienen 4 hijos: Franklin de 16, Linger de 15, Madelin de 13 y Gisela de 9 años.

Cada mañana se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas con sus herramientas de trabajo en mano porque le gusta ver sus chacras siempre limpias. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo desde hace 10 años. Los productos que siembran son el maíz, plátanos, yuca y café. Gracias a la buena administración de las ganancias, su familia no pasa necesidades económicas, sino por lo contrario vive cómodamente.
Para el futuro, desea plantar la mayor cantidad de plátano y maíz, por lo que está comprando más terrenos, con la esperanza de convertirse en una comerciante mayorista de frutos de la selva.

Es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, ella está muy contenta porque su banco comunal se hace fuerte cada día, pues está conformado por personas trabajadoras y responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 150 plantas de plátano y varios sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Eliana is 50 yeras old and lives with her beloved husband Rosalindo, 55. They have 4 children: Franklin, 16, Linger, 15, Madelin, 13 and Gisela, 9. Every morning Eliana works on her agricultural plots with her work tools in hand because she loves to always see her farm clean. She has been doing this activity together with her husband for 10 years. The products that she sews are maize, plantains, yuca and coffee. Thanks to the good administration of her earnings, her family doesn't lack for necessities, in fact they live comfortably. In the future Eliana wishes to plant greater quantities of plaintains and maize, for which reason she is buying more land with the hope of becoming a major wholesaler of jungle fruits. This is the fourth loan she has had with MFP. Eliana is very content because her communal bank makes her strong every day, because it is made up of hard-working and responsible people. WIth the money she is seeking she will buy 150 plantain plants and various sacks of fertiliser.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plantain plants and fertiliser

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mr. Sam P. is married, but his wife died of senility years ago. He now takes care of a teenage child who is no longer in school and works raising pigs from home. Sam P. is aged 57 and earns a living by fishing along the Tunle Sap River. He has operated in this sector since 2000 and is able to make $3 per day. Sam P. has been planning to invest in the pig trade for a year, but has been unable to due to lack of capital. He is therefore looking for a Kiva loan to be used to buy piglets to begin breeding.

loans.use: To buy piglets to begin breeding.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina C. is from the village of Danao. She is 42 years old. Rosalina is married and has 4 adult children. Rosalina owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $132 US) for these activities.

In 2000, Rosalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan, her twelfth, of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en:
Jumoke is 35 years old, married, and blessed with four children. She buys and sells children’s fairly-used clothes. She also supplies clothing materials in bulk to those who retail and she has been in this business since 2007. She manages the business in Lagos where she and her family live.

Jumoke hopes to buy more goods to sell as this will attract more customers to her shop and increase her profit. Jumoke is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to enable her to buy more fairly-used clothes in bales as this is cheaper. She appreciates Kiva for its initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more fairly-used clothes to sell

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a widow with five children and her children go to school. She owns a four roomed house where she stays with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Robinah takes care of additional family members.  The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication. Robinah owns a stall where she sells sweet and Irish potatoes and works in Nakawa Market and receives at least 25 customers a day and her customers are mainly from other markets.  Besides this food business, she also does some tailoring work when need arises. Robinah has been in this business for 20 years and her business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  Robinah has been with MCDT for five years, servicing her 13th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes. She is aspiringof seeing  her business grow bigger and  own a delivery van Robinah decided to work with MCDT because she wanted laons but her no colateral  security

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 56-year-old married man with five children. He has ten years' experience in dairy farming and sells animal products such as meat and milk. John also does carpentry to earn a living. He joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, under a group called Better Ventures Self-Help Group. He is a very active member of the group and attends its weekly meetings regularly. John has also been saving his money with the group. He uses his savings to boost the business. Due to his commitment in paying his loans, he has been allowed to service another loan of 60,000 KES. With this loan, he plans to buy a dairy cow and animal feed. He hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: G.s. Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Organizadas lo conforman Lucia, Mercedes y Matilde. Juntas han logrado superar muchas cosas, por lo que todas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas, en el caso de Dona Lucia ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, hace mas de 15 años que tiene este negocio, su edad es de 43 años, ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y solamente este negocio es su ingreso fijo, ella realiza las compras de los productos en Chinandega, porque es aquí donde le resulta más favorable. Sus otras compañeras Mercedes se dedica a la venta de ropa y Matilde a una pulpería, pues juntas han logrado aprender los diferentes negocios. Actualmente solicitan este financiamiento para invertir en cada uno de sus negocios y comprar los diferentes activos necesarios.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Organizadas” (Organized Women) communal bank’s members are: Lucia, Mercedes and Matilde. Together they have managed to overcome a lot of things; each is involved in a different commercial activity. Lucia has sold cosmetics for over 15 years. She is 43 years old and has three children in her care; this business is their only stable source of income. She buys her stock in Chinandega because prices there are more favorable. Her fellow member Meredes sells clothing and Matilde has a grocery store; together they have learned the various businesses. They are requesting funds to invest in each business and buy the various necessary assets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group Jehova es mi Pastor (God is my Pastor), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Lucia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cosmetics by purchasing Avon and Abel beauty products as well as perfumes, creams and women's underwear. She will use the profits to continue investing in her business, with the long-term goal of saving towards purchasing her own home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products from Avon and Abel, perfumes, cremes and women's underwear to sell

loans.name: Surja Maiya

texts.en:
Surja Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho Village. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. The majority of the people living in this region are Newar, the indigenous people of Nepal's Kathmandu Valley. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people living in this region are engaged in seasonal farming.


Mrs. Surja Maiya M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is engaged in selling chickens. Her husband and son also equally contribute their effort to that business. They sell broiler chickens in their shop. 



Due to the increasing demand of their customers, Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 30,000 to buy chickens for their business.

loans.use: to buy boiler chickens

loans.name: Marisol Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marisol es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, tiene un hijo menor de edad y vive junto a su familia en el C.P.M. Callanca del distrito de Monsefu, un distrito conocido por sus festividades turístico – religiosas y por sus trabajos artesanales hechos en madera, cerámica y junco. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de verduras al por mayor y menor en un puesto de venta dentro del Mercado Los Pathos, un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ella adquiere su mercadería muy temprano a los distribuidores que llegan a su centro de abastos para luego ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes, en su mayoría vendedores de mercados minoristas. Ella se ha hecho conocida en el rubro gracias a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes.

Marisol desea ampliar sus ventas con la compra de más verduras, de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la demanda que existe en la zona, de esa manera ella piensa percibir mas ganancias ymejorar gradualmente su nivel de vida. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles.

Marisol es una mujer alegre y bastante entregada a su trabajo, sumayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marisol is a 32 year old wife and mother. She has one minor child and she lives with her family in the C.P.M. (Minor Population Center) Callanca of the Monsefu district. The district is known for its tourist festivals- religious and connected to its artisanal crafts made of wood, ceramics and reeds. It is located about twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells vegetables wholesale and retail at a stand in the Los Pathos Market, a wholesale market in Chiclayo. She acquires her merchandise very early from the distributors who go to the supply center to offer merchandise to customers, most of whom are sellers in retail markets. She has become well known in the area thanks to the good service she offers her customers. Marisol wants to increase her sales with the purchase of more vegetables in order to better respond to the demand that exists in the area. In this way she plans on obtaining more profit and gradually improve her quality of life. To obtain her goal, it has become necessary for her to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1800 nuevos soles. Marisol is a cheerful woman who is very dedicated to her job. Her greatest wish is to offer her son a better quality of life. She has worked with our institution before and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Xinia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Xinia tiene 36 años de edad reside en el municipio de Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, es acompañada y vive con el cónyuge y una hija de 17 años de edad quien le ayuda a trabajar, tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de comida.
el negocio lo inicio hace 15 años gracias a la ayuda de una señora a quien ella ayudaba anteriormente, hoy tiene su negocio propio y trabaja en un horario de 6:00am- 2:00pm; actualmente ella no cuenta con el dinero para invertir en el negocio por lo cual está solicitando un préstamo, ella compraría una cocina industrial con plancha para elaborar tordillas de maíz, también invertir en materiales para elaboración de alimentos. Contribuirá a mantener el negocio, genera ingresos para solventar necesidades básicas de la familia.
Las aspiraciones de Xinia son tener un comedor amplio que le permita  generar un mejor sistema de vida a la familia.
texts.en:
Xinia is 36 years old and lives in the district of Concepción Batres, in the department of Usulután. She lives with her partner and 17 year old daughter, who helps in her business preparing and selling food. Xinia began her business 15 years ago, thanks to the help of a lady who she had helped earlier. Today, she has her own business and works from 6:00am to 2:00pm. At present, she does not have the money she needs to invest in her business and has therefore requested this loan. She will use the loan to pay for a professional kitchen, in which she will make corn tortillas. She will also use the money to buy cooking materials. The loan will enable her to continue her business and generate an income to meet the basic needs of her family. Xinia hopes one day to have a large dining room, which will contribute to a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a professional kitchen, for making corn tortillas.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda A. is from the city of Sta Cruz, Tangub City. She is 42 years old. Alfreda is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Alfreda owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Alfreda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alfreda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alfreda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Antonia G., tiene la edad de 54 años, habitante de la zona Laureles Norte, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad, que apoyan a su madre en los gastos en que ella incurre mensualmente, ella se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones y labora como empleada domestica, desde hace mas de 3 años.

Ella laboraba en Costa Rica y con sus ahorros logro mejorar las condiciones de su hogar con el propósito de aumentar las rentas de sus cuartos, ahora ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que permitan la edificación del muro izquierdo de su casa con el propósito de dividir su terreno con el de su vecino, a futuro espera ampliar los cuartos hasta donde llegue la construcción del muro que se construirá. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar las rentas de sus cuartos, favoreciendo a la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Antonia G. is a resident of the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is 54 years old and is a single mother to 6 older children that help her with her monthly expenses. She rents rooms for a living as well as working as a domestic employee for the past 3 years. She used to work in Costa Rica and with her savings she was able to make improvements to her home with the intention of increasing the rent for her rooms. She is now requesting a loan to buy construction materials to build a wall on the left side of her house to divide the land with her neighbor. In the future, she hopes to expand the rooms out to wall that that will be built. This investment will allow her to ask more rent for her rooms and improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino R. is from the town of Talibon. He is 56 years old. Marcelino is married and has three children. To make a living, Marcelino operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Marcelino has been engaged in his business for over 10 years.

Marcelino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelino has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marcelino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia R. D. M. D. 56 años D. edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien vive únicamente junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero construyendo calles. Virginia resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, en donD. posee un pequeño bazar en el cual comercializa productos varios como: ropa para mujeres, zapatos, cacerolas, tazas, libros y accesorios para regalo. DesD. hace muchos años que ella trabaja en su bazar, surtiéndolo poco a poco, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. ropa y zapatos, los cuales son los que más comercializa en el lugar. Así mismo Virginia desea comprar algunos juguetes debido a que se acerca la celebración del día del niño, fecha en la que sus ventas se incrementas. D. esta forma Virginia desea salir adelanta y D. esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Virginia R. D. M., 56, is a very hard working person.  She lives only with her husband who works as a laborer building streets.  Virginia lives in Ilopango where she has a small store where she sells such things as: women’s clothing, shoes, pots, cups, books and gift wrapping supplies.  

She has worked in her store for several years stocking it little by little.  This is why she is asking for funding in order to stock the business buying a greater amount of clothing and shoes which are the items that sell best.  

Virginia also wants to buy some toys because the feast day dedicated to children is approaching and sales increase then.  Virginia hopes thus to get ahead and have a better life for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and household items.

loans.name: Pablo Javier

texts.es:
La señor Pablo Javier B. Burgos tiene 19 años y vive en la ciudad de Tarija -Cercado. Pablo actualmente está estudiando en la carrera de arquitectura y durante la semana se dedica a sus estudios y a los días viernes y sábados o cuando se le presente un contrato de su amplificación se dedica a su actividad, la cual seria, la de dj" de su amplificación y locutor de un medio de comunicación social, la misma lleva el nombre de radio Atlántida  y según se contrate su amplificación, él percibe un ingreso económico por evento social lo cual mensualmente obtiene un ingreso mensual, aparte de su ingreso como locutor de donde también percibe ingresos mensuales. Este ingreso le permite a Pablo cubrir sus gastos de estudios de la universidad. 

Pablo nos dice que con el crédito que sacara lo invertirá en la compra de un equipo portatil que maneje las consolas de amplificación ya que la compactera que el tenia para manejar las mismas se le quemo este equipo portatil será completamente laboral para su amplificación Pablo sostiene que la compra de este equipo le permitirá obtener más ingresos ya que con la experiencia de 2 años que tiene en este rubro piensa trabajar de manera individual a la de la radio. Ya asi terminar sus estudios y ser un profesional eficiente.
texts.en:
Pablo Javier B. Burgos is 19 years old and lives in the city of Tarija - Cercado. Pablo is currently studying architecture and during the week he studies. On Fridays and Saturdays, or when he is presented a sound system contract, he is a sound system DJ and mass media announcer for a radio station called Atlántida. According to his contract to provide sound system services, he receives a monthly income for social events, which is separate from his income as an announcer where he also receives a monthly income. This income allows Pablo to cover his expenses to study at the university.

With the loan he is requesting, Pablo will invest it in the purchase of portable equipment that manages the sound system consoles, since he burned out the player that he had to play the CDs. This portable equipment will be used strictly for work purposes. Pablo maintains that with the purchase of this equipment, it will allow him to earn more income. With his two years of experience that he has in this area, he is thinking about working in an individual manner at the radio. He will finish his studies and be an efficient professional.

loans.use: To buy portable equipment to manage the consoles for sound system equipment

loans.name: Virgilia Edith

texts.en:
Virgilia is a member of the Communal Bank "Pink Women," located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao and the department of Puno. She is 22 years old, single, and has no children. She has a secondary school education. 

Virgilia has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. She buys and sells small animals (rams and pigs).  Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the working capital for her business. 

She is now asking for a loan for 500 PEN for additional investment in her business.  Manuela dreams of having a grocery store one day.  What she likes most about the Communal Bank is the group work.

loans.use: To invest in her business of buying and selling small animals

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida lives in Kamoki which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its rice industry. She lives there in the area named Muhallah azizpura in a two-room brick house with her family. She moved here fifteen years ago after her marriage. 

Her husband, M. K., has a balloons-selling business. Balloons are considered children’s playthings. Children are fond of balloons and M. sells a variety of balloons by visiting different areas of the community on his bicycle. His variety and different colors are the reason for his good sales. 
 
Sajida herself is a housewife. She spends most of her time doing her household work, but in her spare time she helps her husband fill the balloons with air. They have an air machine that helps to fill the balloons. She has given birth to three sons and three daughters. Her three elder children are enrolled in school and getting their education, while the remaining children are below five years of age. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy balloon packets in bulk quantities, which will help increase his sales.  Sajida is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her husband and that he will be able to improve his business with it.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.

loans.use: To buy balloon packets in quantity for balloons-selling business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria R. is from the village of San Jose, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Maria is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2007, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

Maria is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Maria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca N. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Francisca is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Capuyo Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Capuyo, le nombraron así porque es una flor que va renaciendo. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes. ManueL. M. es L. tesorera del grupo. Tiene 38 años D. edad, estudió hasta L. preparatoria, es comerciante, está casada y tiene un hijo D. 12 años.ElL. inició en el ambito del comercio hace aproximadame 15 años, empezó vendiendo pan con sus vecinos y actualmente cuenta con una  tienda con L. cual ya tiene 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en algunos artículos que le hacen falta, tales como un refrigerador para lácteos, quiere agrandar su tienda ya que tiene muchos clientes y quiere tener aun más. Almomento D. solicitar este credito se siente orgullosa D. si y espera lograr su meta junto con su familia.
texts.en: The group is called Capuyo and they named it this because it is a flower that continues to be reborn. The group is located in the state of México and is maD. up of new members. ManueL. M. is the treasurer of the group. She is thirty-eight years old and studied up until high school. She is a business owner, married and has a son who is twelve years old. She started in the business world about fifteen years ago. She started by selling bread with her neighbors and she currently has had her own store for two years now. She requests the loan to invest in some things she doesn't have such as a refrigerator for dairy products. She also wants to make her store bigger because she has a lot of customers and she wants to have even more. She feels very proud for requesting the loan and hopes to reach her goal with the support of her family.

loans.use: To make her business grow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Jane F. is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Jane is widow and has five adult-age children. To make a living, Jane owns and operates a mini-grocery business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In January 2009, Jane joined PMPC under pension loan program to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a loan of 50,000 PHP. Jane is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery stocks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. has been selling corn and cassava dough at Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast, for three years now. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Her income from the sale of corn and cassava dough pays for their children’s school fees and their utility bills. She wishes to improve her earnings by purchasing larger quantities of maize and cassava to generate higher sales. Her profits will be reinvested to grow her business further. 

In this picture, Abena is showing the maize she uses for the corn dough.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize and cassava.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 33-year-old married man with 6 children who lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. His goal is to educate his children in private schools. He has a business selling beans and distilling local brew.  He has been running this business for three years, raising his initial capital from farming. He is facing the challenge of transportation; in future he hopes to expand his business to other markets. Alex needs the loan to set up a store and increase his produce inventory.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase agricultural produce.

loans.name: 0304017 Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en:
Loan N. T. (115) is a 59-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Loan is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0304017 Lien Ha-Hoang Thanh (0304017 Lien Ha-Hoang Thanh).

Loan is married and has five adult children. To making a living, Loan operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for saL.. Loan has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Loan joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to expand a shelter for her livestock. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be her eighth loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Loan plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. T. Binh (26) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. N. T. Son (2) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

3. L. T. Xuyen (21) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

4. N. T. Ngo (27) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products.

5. L. T. Xuyen (22) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling home products.

About the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Loan N. T. (115) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Loan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0304017 Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (0304017 Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. Loan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Loan kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2004, Loan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Loan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mở rộng chuồng cho gia súc của người vay. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Binh (26) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Son (2) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. L. T. Xuyen (21) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 4. N. T. Ngo (27) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 5. L. T. Xuyen (22) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a member of Dandora Victory Self Help group.  She has been tailoring for three years.  She is married with five children.  She works hard in her business so as to help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested her first loan of 10, 000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José tiene  65  años de edad,  casado, con carga familiar, Vive en casa  propia, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, en Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

José cuenta con negocio en el mercado Modelo y se dedica a la venta de repuestos y accesorios para la actividad automotriz, con puesto fijo, con más de 11 años de experiencia en el rubro.  Estos ingresos le sirven para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

José desea apoyar a su hijo con sus gastos  universitarios,  por lo que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old. He is married and has a family. He lives in his own house, located in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, in Chiclayo, capital of the departamento of Lambayeque.

José has a business in the Modelo market and he sells replacement parts and accessories for cars. He has a set space and more than 11 years experience in this area. This income helps him supprt his family financially.  

José wants to help his son with university expenses. For this he has found it useful to get a loan of 1000 nuevos soles in Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to help pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Mouk's Group

texts.en: The 16 people we see here are part of a loan group led by Mrs. Mouk, who is married, has three children and was born in 1983. Her husband, Mr. Pring, who was born in 1984, makes a living as a construction worker. One of their children is in school now while the other two are too young to attend. Mrs. Mouk makes a living as a farmer, growing rice on a small plot of land she owns. She has applied for this loan to prepare for her next crop by buying fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay the laborers she hires to help on the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay the laborers who work on her farm.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame K. has been preparing and selling kenkey in Elmina for three years now. Kenkey is a local and very popular staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fish. Maame wants to expand her business and plans to use her loan from Kiva to purchase more maize, which will allow her to prepare more kenkey for sale.

Maame has three children, and her earnings pay for their school fees and the household expenses. She plans to save any extra earnings for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to allow her to prepare more kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is married with four children. Her husband operates a grocery store in the community market. Through his store, he sells daily use items like cooking oil, spices, sugar etc. He is very good in dealing and earns good profits from his business. 

She herself is a housewife as well as a working lady. She manages her household and also operates a clothes-making business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and earns good money by completing them on time. 

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put into his store. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Kaneez hopes that an investment will help him in making his business better and provide a better financial life to the family. 

She is a regular loan user and this is her third loan application to Asasah. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a grocery store business

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 39 year old husband to Janet, a housewife. He and his wife have two children. Martin is an industrious carpenter who operates a carpentry workshop at Kibuye – a large open air market within Kisumu town. He has been working there for the last sixteen years. He designs household items like beds, tables and any furniture, as per client specifications. He makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Martin recently joined KADET LTD and has qualified for a first loan of KES 20,000 which he will use to buy carpentry materials like nails, velvet materials and polish. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more materials for his workshop, since his dream is to have a big carpentry workshop within Kibuye market area.

loans.use: to purchase timber, nails and velvet for the carpentry business.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana mujer trabajadora, casada, tiene estudiando a su hijo, en estos momentos requiere mejora la infraestructura de su vivienda, con su propio negocio de venta de ropa  que lo inicio desde hace un tiempo con fondos de micro créditos vendiendo menores cantidades de productos. A la actualidad vende mayores cantidades y variedad. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio e nivel de vida. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: perlines, láminas de zinc, golosa,  estribu entre otros para el cambio del techo de la casa obteniendo protección y comodidad.
texts.en: Ana, a hard-working woman, has a son in school and is currently in need of home improvement.  She has her own business selling clothing which she set up some time ago with micro loans and by selling small quantities of items.  She now sells more volume and variety.  She is grateful to the institution for the support that has helped her develop her business and improve her lifestyle.  The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as: profiles, zinc sheeting, studs, and supports, among other items, to change the roof on her house for better protection and comfort.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 27 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Arlene runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. Arlene has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She has borrowed and paid 7 previous loans from NWTF. 

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is 53 years old and is married to Jesusa who operates a retail store in their village. In order to make additional income, Leo is engaged in farming. He raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He usually earns PHP 40,000 each cropping season. Income generated from the business has gone on school fees and investment in the retail shop. Leo is now asking for a loan of PHP 29,000 to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizers necessary to ensure better yield. He hopes this loan will help grow his operation to increase his profits. In the future, Leo hopes to make consistent profits and maintain economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizers necessary to ensure better yield.

loans.name: Maisha Zakhiem Group

texts.en:
Ashura, who is in her mid 20's, is single. She has been running a soft drinks business for 8 months now. She works from 8 a.m to 7 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujujenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more water, juice and sodas to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to sell new clothes from door-to-door and also to be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Misha Zakhiem", which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more water, juice and sodas to sell

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children.

Moustafa has owned a barber shop since 2005. He has good experience and a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,800 loan to make a lighted Ad board and to purchase two barber chairs for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To make a lighted Ad board and to purchase two barber chairs.

loans.name: Jarintzi

texts.es: Jarintzi tiene 23 años de edad ella actualmente estudia la universidad en la ciudad de Morelia Michoacán, es soltera y aparte de ser estudiante ella vende cosméticos y zapatos por catalogo desde hace 2 años  y dice que emprendió su negocio para ayudar a sus papas con los gastos de la escuela ya que sus libros que ocupa son un poco caros y también para pagar los gastos personales que tiene. Jary como de cariño le dicen sus conocidos esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de productos de belleza y zapatos que sus clientas le han encargado, uno de sus sueños de Jari es terminar su carrera y mas adelante tener un negocio de venta de zapatos, ropa y accesorios para dama.
texts.en:
Jarintzi, 23, is attending university in Morelia, Michoacán.  She’s single and besides being a student she’s sold cosmetics and shoes via catalogue for the last two years.  She says she started the business to help her parents with her school costs because the textbooks she needs are a bit expensive and also to pay for her personal expenses.

Jary, like her acquaintances affectionately call her, is asking for a loan to buy beauty products and shoes that her customers have ordered from her.  One of Jari’s dreams is to complete her career and later on have a business selling shoes, clothes and women’s accessories.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Porn, 49 years old, sells palm fruit and food, earning the income of $3 per day. She is a single mother who lives with four children. One is studying and the other three are working in the factory earning $3 per day for each. Every month, Porn has to spend $70 on food, $12 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy material for repairing her house. She plans to buy a stock of rice for resale when there is a good price.

loans.use: To buy material for repairing her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar power system

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 54-year-old man, and he is married with four sons and three daughters. He is a school teacher with a decent salary. 

Mohammad has his own project which is a grocery store. He wants to purchase more groceries so he can have a better collection for sale to increase his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $1,300 from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase more groceries and have a variety of products and groceries for sale. He will then have the ability to compete and sell more, in order to have a better income and provide better life conditions for his family. 

Mohammad is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Selelo

texts.en:
Selelo is a very hardworking man who operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been doing this for the past three years. He is a good client who was introduced to KADET through marketing done by KADET staff within the town. He has applied for his first loan which he plans to use to buy a saloon car. He hopes to use the car for taxi operations; thus, getting better income than with a motorcycle.

His dreams are to be rich and self-sustainable in his life.

loans.use: to buy a saloon car for taxi operation

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru: Мафтуна проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Мафтуна живет вместе с родителями. Раньше Мафтуна помогала маме в торговле, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется свой бизнес. Она занимается торговлей на рынке, в основном продает фрукты. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Matfuna lives in the town of Isfara.  She is 20 years old and not married.  Matfuna lives together with her parents.  Previously, she helped her mother with sales and today has her own business.  She is involved in sales at the market and primarily sells fruits.  Matfuna is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a local butcher in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He acquired his initial capital from farming, and in future he dreams of owning and operating a wholesale shop. He and his wife live with their four children between the ages of four and 14 in a semi-permanent house. Robert aspires toward educating his children to higher levels.

Robert is requesting a loan in order to buy pigs for slaughter and sale at his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughter and sale at his butcher shop

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells orange in Dompose. She is married to a farmer and has seven dependents. Esi assists her husband to provide for their family. Her loan will be used to purchase more oranges. Esi plans to expand her orange business.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 46 años, es un hombre muy fuerte, amante de la naturales y muy trabajador, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene siete hijos de los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes y los otros cinco tienen 19, 17, 12, 9 y 2 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Pedro consiste en la siembra de arroz en una chacra que alquila, aprovecha las condiciones del lugar, en época de lluvia los siembra y brinda los cuidados necesarios para poder ver crecer de a poco a sus plantas. Lleva realizando este trabajo por dos años, lo hace con la ayuda de alguno de sus hijos quienes están aprendiendo cada día mas y mas sobre el trabajo con el cual su padre les puede brindar educación y alimentación. Le va muy bien ya que tiene buenas ventas, es proveedor de tres molinos importantes de la región quienes están siempre a la expectativa que lleve sus productos a venderlos, ya que siembra uno de los mejores productos de la región. Al principio le fue complicado realizar este trabajo ya que no tenía mucho conocimiento, pero aprovecho algunas charlas que le dieron en unos talleres y aprendió todo lo que necesitaba. No se considera un experto pero los conocimientos que tiene le permite cosechar un buen producto. Desea mas adelante tener su propia chacra ya que cuando alquila se le va parte de su ganancia, además desea poner una bodega en su casa en donde su conviviente pueda vender y generar un ingreso adicional a su economía. Este será el cuarto préstamo con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará productos para montar su tienda en su casa, además de invertir un poco en el pago de peones para el mantenimiento de su chacra.
texts.en:
Pedro, 46, is a very strong man, a lover of nature, and very hard-working. He lives with his partner, and they have seven children, two of whom are now adults and on their own. The other five are ages 19, 17, 12, 9, and 2.  They live together in their own house, that they managed to buy with a lot of effort. 

Pedro grows rice on a small farm that he rents. He takes advantage of local conditions; in the rainy season he plants his crop, and provides the necessary care to see his plants grow little by little. 

He has been doing this work for two years, with the help of some of his children, who are learning more and more about the work each day. This way, their father can provide them with both learning and food.  It's going very well for him, as he has good sales. He is a supplier to three important mills in the area, who are always waiting for him to bring them his crop to sell, as he produces one of the best crops in the area.

In the beginning, it was very complicated for him to carry out this work, as he didn't have a lot of knowledge. But he took advantage of various workshop sessions, and learned everything he needed. 

He doesn't consider himself an expert, but the knowledge he has allows him to harvest a good crop. In the future he wishes to have his own small farm, as when he rents, this takes away part of his earnings. 

In addition, he wishes to set up a small store in his house, where his partner can sell merchandise and generate additional income for their household finances. 

This will be his fourth loan with MFP. He is very happy to know that he will have a loan, since in this way, he will feel secure in moving forward with his business. Moreover, he is committed to once again making his instalment payments. 

With the amount applied for, 1,500 soles, he will buy products for stocking the store in his house, and also spend a bit to pay laborers, so that he can maintain his small farm.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking his store, and to hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two  nephews).

Teopista has a business of a pub.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days a week.  Teopista sells her products from home, by means of retail.   Teopista has requested  for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin. She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Teopista include transportating jerycans of local Gin and crates of beef and Soda from the market to her home, and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation and  also to build more rental rooms. Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin et sont issus de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, Yèyinou Jacqueline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 48 ans. Yèyinou Jacqueline est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Emmanuel. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yèyinou Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Yèyinou Jacqueline n’a pas fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Yèyinou Jacqueline vend depuis trois ans des bouteilles vides dans un marché du Bénin. Yèyinou Jacqueline s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité, Yèyinou Jacqueline sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: DJROMAHUTON is a group of four people whose members live in the same neighborhood in Benin and who are from the same family. The group representative, Yèyinou Jacqueline (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 48 years old. Yèyinou Jacqueline is married to a salesman named Emmanuel. The couple has two children, both of whom attend school and who are under their care. Yèyinou Jacqueline lives with her husband and children. The couple shares the household expenses. Yèyinou Jacqueline did not attend school. To meet her different responsibilities, Yèyinou Jacqueline has been selling empty bottles at a market in Benin for three years. Yèyinou Jacqueline stocks up in Benin. In the goals of satisfying her clientele and increase her business, Yèyinou Jacqueline is seeking a second loan with ALIDé with the other members of the DJROMAHUTON group. This loan will help them better meet the needs of their clientele and earn more money. The first loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy empty bottles

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself as strong. Kennedy operates a farm where he grows sugarcane. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low prices. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. He hopes that in the future to be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old and lives in the Wekhonye area of Kitale with her two children. Her family is the most important thing in her life, and the reason why she works hard at her mixed farmer, something her parents taught him to do. She is a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She has a side hustle business(motorbike business)
Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop which she has been planting for as long as she can remember. She also does dairy farming. With time, the fertility of her land has started to dwindle and whenever she plants maize the yields go down with each cropping season. Today, Rose is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy good quality cereals. Through this loan Rose is going to increase her cereal selling business and this will translate to an improved income level. Kitale area has a ready market for cereals and through this loan she will meet the demand.
This loan will permanently change the living standards of Rose; there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in farming.
Change the life of this farmer, make a loan.

loans.use: To buy good quality cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Marie Jeannette M.

texts.en:
Marie Jeanette Makpowoassinou A., 29, is married, the mother of three children, and guardian of three others from her deceased older brother. She is a hairdresser by profession. Her husband teaches part-time on a farm and makes $20 a month, which barely covers one day of family expenses.
