Aware of the situation, she began a small business selling beauty products to make ends meet. However, the lack of sufficient means, particularly working capital, poses a serious handicap to her deteriorating finances. And this highly devoted and enterprising woman is becoming poorer and poorer as a result. So she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to grow her shop by paying cash for beauty supplies, a much less costly way to do it. She may also acquire certain tools of the trade, notably two hairdryers. The goal is to open a very modern hair salon of her own. And the loan will help increase her turnover, so that she can provide for her family at all times.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 29 ans, Madame A. Marie Jeannette Makpowoassinou est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et a à sa charge les trois (03) enfants de son grand frère décédé. Son mari est enseignant volontaire dans une ferme et dont le salaire de $20 par mois, couvre à peine les dépenses d’une journée. Consciente de cet état de chose, Madame A., coiffeuse de formation, s’est lancée dans le petit commerce de produits de beauté afin de joindre les deux bouts. Mais le manque de moyens suffisants surtout le fonds de roulement constitue un handicap sérieux à son décollage économique et accentue la paupérisation de cette dame très dévouée et entreprenante. Aussi, sollicite t-elle un crédit de $1000 pour agrandir sa boutique en payant comptant et donc très moins cher ses produits et à acquérir certains matériels de travail notamment deux séchoirs en vue d’ouvrir son atelier de coiffure très moderne. Ce crédit l’aidera à augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de subvenir à tout moment aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase hairdryers and to open a hair salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in rice farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise, such as clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Log Kor

texts.en: Log Kor lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has 3 children. She knits. She works in her home and sells her crafts in the bazaar. She loves to help her husband with the family expenses so she wants to take a group loan to buy extra materials for her business. She hopes to have lots of clients to improve her business and make a better future for her family. She is happy.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
"I used to work as a nurse at a prominent medical center, but my low salary required me to work at other jobs like dispatching legal documents and certificates and others. Unfortunately, due to an accident, I had to quit my job as a nurse without being able to wait for a second job as a paper dispatcher. "

Today, Justa Álvarez is a mother of 4, and her main job consists of making pastries. She learned the skills from her mother, who was a pastrymaking instructor at a culinary institute. Thus, Justa makes her baked goods and sells them as much as she can in the school where she works, and caters for parties, birthdays and other events as well. Justa needs capital to stock up on supplies to increase production, especially for the big festival of Todos Santos (All Saints) in November, in which it is traditional to eat various baked goods and pastries. With the loan, Justa will hopefully be able to profit from this event to set up her own bakery in the comforts of her own home and ensure her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

"Trabajaba como enfermera en un importante centro médico, pero el bajo nivel de su salario la obligó a dedicarse a otras actividades, como la de tramitadora de documentos, certificados y otros. Lastimosamente a causa de un accidente, tuve que dejar de trabajar como enfermera, sin poder atender su segundo oficio de tramitadora. "

Hoy en día Justa Álvarez, es madre de 4 hijos, y su actividad principal es la repostería, este es un oficio que ella aprendió de su madre, quien era maestra técnica en repostería y enseñaba en un instituto. Por tal motivo, Justa prepara sus productos y vende, tanto en el colegio donde trabaja, como también en la atención de contratos para fiestas, cumpleaños y otros. Justa precisa de capital, para poder abastecerse de insumos para incrementar su producción, principalmente para la gran demanda existente en la fiesta de Todos Santos en el mes de Noviembre, fecha en la que es una tradición el consumo de distintos productos de repostería. De esta manera Justa podrá lograr la ganancia esperada para establecer una tienda repostera en su propio domicilio, y así asegurar su bienestar familiar.

loans.use: Justa needs capital to stock up on supplies to increase production especially for the big event of Todos Santos in November, where it is traditional to consume various baked goods

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is an enterprising woman who works hard every day in her shop to help her family. She decided to begin this business because her husband abandoned her and their young children two years ago, leaving them without any support. In her ongoing efforts to progress forward, she would like to increase the variety and quality of the products she offers, growing her business into a larger operation in a well stocked location. She is requesting a loan to help grow the business. In this way, she will get closer and closer to her goals. Let's help her in her efforts to improve the quality of life for her children.

Hilda, es una mujer emprendedora que cada día gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que pone en su tienda de venta de artículos para el hogar ha satisfecho eficientemente las necesidades de su familia. Ella decidió dedicarse a esta labor debido a la gran necesidad que existía en su casa, ya que su esposo la abandonó hace dos años, dejando a sus dos menores hijos sin ningún amparo y totalmente desconsolados, fue así como se convirtió en padre y madre para ellos.En su continuo afán de progreso desea incrementar la calidad y variedad de sus productos para dejar de realizarlo en pequeña magnitud y empezar a desarrollar su labor a gran escala contando para este propósito con un local adecuado. Para emprender este sueño desea comprar mayor cantidad de pequeños artículos y solicita un préstamo. De esta manera poco a poco irá incrementando su capital de inversión e irá cristalizando sus anhelos. Colaboremos con este noble afán para que Hilda siga forjando con su esfuerzo y amor los sueños de sus hijitos.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS SO THAT SHE CAN GROW AND INCREASE HER INCOME.  AS A SINGLE MOTHER, HER GOAL IS TO  PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER TWO CHILDREN.

loans.name: Silvestra's Group

texts.es:
Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra belong to the Communal Bank Azucenas for 5, 3, and 10 years respectively. In their Communal Bank they learned to be responsible, punctual, supportive, and to save.

Florisa is 28 years old and has 1 daughter. Florisa sells groceries and vegetables in the markets of Cangallo, Vilcas Huamán and Huamanguilla. She began her business 5 years ago with her first loan from the Communal Bank.

Rosario is 70 years old and has 7 children, and she sells cheese in the different stores and homes in Ayucucho.

Silvestra is 40 years old and has 4 children, she sells wool in a stand in the Las Américas market. Before Silvesetra had a grocery store in her home, but closed it due to lack of sales.

Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, and 1200 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, preserves, oil, milk, carrots, celery, onion, pumpkin, tomato, cheese, wool of different colors and brands. Their savings will be utilized to build a house, to increase capital for the business, and for unforeseen expenses.

Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra have dreams of having a car to transport their products, build their houses, have their own money and be great businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Florisa, Rosario y Silvestra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Azucenas desD. hace 5, 3 y 10 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales, solidarias y a ahorrar.

Florisa tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Florisa venD. abarrotes y verduras en las ferias D. Cangallo, Vilcas Huamán y Huamanguilla. Su negocio se inició hace 5 años con su primer préstamo que sacó D. su Banco Comunal.

Por otro lado Rosario tiene 70 años y 7 hijos, y venD. queso en las diferentes tiendas y casas D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Silvestra tiene 40 años y 4 hijos y venD. lanas en un puesto del mercado Las Américas. Antes Silvestra tenía una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, pero lo cerró porque no tenía venta.

Florisa, Rosario y Silvestra necesitan préstamos D. 1600 soles, 400 soles y 1200 soles, respectiamente que serán invertidos en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, conservas, aceite, leche, zanahoria, apio, cebolla, zapallo, tomate, queso, lanas D. diferentes colores y marcas. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para la construcción D. su casa, para incrementar el capital D. su negocio y para imprevistos.

Los sueños D. Florisa, Rosario y Silvestra son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, construir su casa, tener capital propio y ser grandes empresarias.

loans.use: Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, and 1200 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, preserves, oil, milk, carrots, celery, onion, pumpkin, tomato, cheese, wool of different colors and brands.

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hằng, 32 years old, is married with 3 school age children. She has a general stand at the market and also tends her vegetable garden. Her husband is a laborer. Their income is about 6USD a day. They have never taken out loan from anyone. They will use funds from their first loan of 150USD with Binh Minh to increase production of her vegetable garden to get ready for the Tết.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hằng, 32 tuổi, có 3 con còn đang đi học. Công việc tạo thu nhập chính của chị là làm nghề đi chợ bán hàng tạp hoá. Bên cạnh đó, chị còn trồng rau để tăng thu nhập. Chồng chị làm công nhân. Thu nhập trung bình hai vợ chồng là 100000đ/ngày. Anh chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay anh chị tham gia Chương trình tài chính vi mô vì thích hình thức trả góp hàng tuần lại không phải thế chấp. Với số tiền 2006000đ vay được, anh chị sẽ trồng hoa màu để bán, đặc biệt phục vụ cho dịp Tết năm nay.

loans.use: Increase production of the vegetable garden

loans.name: Atwa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48 year-old Atwa H.. She is widowed with four children, aged between 20 and 30.

In 2001, Atwa established a soft drinks business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, seven days a week, and assisted by her children and one employee, she earns about $100 per month from this business. Atwa has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drink, water, juice, and milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $70. In the future, Atwa also plans to renovate or expand her shop. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drink, water, juice, and milk.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is a 27-year-old mother of three children. Judith and her husband live in Kisumu, Kenya. Judith has received three microfinance loans from KMET. She began her tailoring business in the year 2000 in Rongo, Kenya. In 2006 she moved her business location to Kisumu to join her husband who works in Kisumu. Since then she has successfully built a business due to the added advantage of access to loan capital from KMET/KIVA, hard work and perseverance. She specializes in both men's and women's dresses.

The central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community have gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and materials and build a successful income-generating business.

Judith is proud of her accomplishments and that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. To further expand her business she has applied for US $700 to enable her to purchase a variety of clothes-making materials and also purchase other stock and tailoring supplies to keep up with the growing demand.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Increase a variety of cloth making materials and stock of tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin has been a member of the communal bank "Azucenas" for 10 years. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Karin sells sweets and groceries out of her home, which located near a urban transportation business. Karin also works as a secretary for the transportation business.

Karin needs a loan for $725, money that she will invest in buying assorted cookies, soda, rice, sugar, and soap.

Karin dreams of being able to stock her business, of buying a car, and of having a computer for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karin es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas hace 10 años.

Karin es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Karin vende golosinas y abarrotes en su casa, que esta ubicado cerca de una empresa de transporte urbano. Además Karin trabaja como secretaria de la empresa de transportes.

Karin necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas variadas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar y jabón.

Los sueños de Karin son surtir su negocio, tener un carro y una computadora para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her grocery store, such as cookies, soda, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Chorn P. is 29 years of age, and from a young age she has helped operate a small grocery store and worked in the rice fields with her family. She currently earns $1 per day through these activities.  Her husband, Neang Sna,  37 years of age, is a blacksmith in Phnom Penh, a city that offers the best pay for his trade. He earns $3 per day and hopes to someday earn more. In order to better support him and their two children, Chorn P. wants to buy a good set of blacksmith tools for her husband to use and thereby eventually raise their income.

loans.use: To buy blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban Ramon P. was born in the city of Ita in 1955. He has been married to his wife, Maria Gloria Martinez for more than 20 years. They have a daughter named Maria Ceclia who studies at school and also helps them with the general store they run from their home.

Esteban sells fruits and vegetables from his truck to various businesses in Luque, in addition to what he sells from his shop. He has been with the foundation since 2003, growing his business with the help of the loans.

El señor Esteban Ramon P. nació en la ciudad de Itá, Departamento de Central, en el año 1955, esta casado con Maria Gloria Martínez hace mas de 20 años y tiene una hija de nombre Maria Cecilia que actualmente esta cursando la secundaria y quien la ayuda a manejar el negocio que tienen en su domicilio.

El señor P. provee de frutas y verduras con su camioneta a varios negocios de Luque como también lo comercializa en su despensa. Opera con la Fundación desde el año 2003 logrando un mayor movimiento comercial con los créditos recibidos.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FRUITS, VEGETABLES, SUGAR, MILK, EGGS, BAKERY GOODS, NOODLES, AND OTHER ITEMS TO STOCK HIS GENERAL STORE.

loans.name: Mashavu

texts.en:
43-year-old Mashavu is married, with four children between the ages of 13 and 23. Since 2007, she opened a clothes shop where she works daily from 6am to 4pm. She earns a monthly profit of $140 from her sales.

Mashavu now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is married with 32, 29 and 25 year old children. She has owned her own crafts shop since 2001.She works from 10am to 7pm everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Subira has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Subira now requests a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S. is a 45-year-old man who is married with 2 children. He has owned his veterinary medicine shop since 2000. This is very popular product among farmers, because majority of people keep livestock and need to give them injections every two to three months. He needs $1200 USD to increase number of medicines that he sells.

loans.use: To increase number of medicine he sells.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra baji is the widow of S. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and saint places. She owns a four room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Bushra baji’s brother lives with her and is involved in a cloth and rug making business. He has a power loom machine with which he makes clothes and rugs. He has been in this business for the last 15 years. He charges $10 to $12 for one rug. Bushra baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy more thread so that her brother is able to make more rugs and to sell them in the market to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy more thread to make rugs and clothes

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn B. is 41 years old, married, and the father of three children who are attending the local school. He and his family live in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife, Mrs. Khat Heang (on the left of the photo), is an ice cream seller.

Their family doesn't have enough income to improve their living conditions. Thus, Mr. Sorn B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Heidy Thalia

texts.es:
La señora Heidy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 620, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el aserradero “Aserrador”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de dulces, aguajes y gaseosas. Tiene una bebe recién nacida, motivo por el cual está de descanso médico y para ello tiene el apoyo de su querida madre. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 6 moldes de dulces, 2 sacos de aguajes, 6 paquetes de gaseosas, etc.

Heidy es una mujer con muchos deseos de triunfar en la vida para poder darle una buena educación a sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Heidy belongs to the "Loreto" Community Bank. She lives on Comandante Suárez Nº 620 in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province in the department of Ucayali. She is 28 years old, and the mother of two young children who depend on her. Heidy is married and her husband works in the sawmill. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Heidy invested in a clothing sales business. She's been working for three years with the community bank. Now Heidy sells candy, fruits, and sodas. She has a newborn baby, and is now on bed rest, while her mother helps out with the business. With his loan of 1,000 soles Heidy will buy six candy plasters, two bags of aguaje fruits, six packs of sodas, etc. She'll repay the loan in five months. Heidy wants badly to triumph in life so that she can provide a good education to her beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll buy six candy molds, two sacks of aguaje fruits, six packs of sodas, etc.

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en: Matanat is a mother of 2 children. She lives in city of Baku. She started this business five years ago. She was born in 1965. Now she needs a loan to buy foodstuffs to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
E., pictured here, is 29 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He earns a profit by selling fish and pork in the local busy market; he starts his work in the early morning and finishes in the afternoon, and he can earn an average of $5 per day. He currently works very hard at his investment activities in order to manage his one lovely young child. He is married to Chatha, 30, who earns a living raising pigs from home.

To expand the business and to earn more income, E. is requesting a loan as capital to buy additional fish and pork to sell and some piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional fish and pork to sell and some piglets to raise

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar B. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá se dedica a la curtiduría de cueros vacunos hace varios años, actividad que es una tradición en su familia, ya que sus padres y hermanos también se dedican a este rubro.
      Actualmente esta viviendo con su madre, cuenta con una buena clientela formada hace varios años, con el crédito que accedió en nuestra entidad pudo hacerse de capital de trabajo para la compra de insumos o materia prima para la producción de sus productos y cubrir varios pedidos que tenía, y lograr un buen márgen de utilidad.
      Esta muy agradecido a nuestra entidad por la confianza y el apoyo que le brindamos para emprender su proyecto de trabajo, y espera retribuirnos con su buen cumplimiento
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar B., in the city of Carapeguá, has been running a tannery for cow leather for many years, an activity that is traditional in his family. His parents and brothers are also involved in this field.

Today he lives with his mother, and has a good clientèle of many years. With this loan that we agreed to, he can have the capital to buy raw materials for making his products, cover many orders that he has and achieve a good margin of profit.

He is very thankful to us for our confidence and support that we give him to continue his work, and he hopes to repay us with his good performance.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather

loans.name: Denis Noel

texts.es: El Señor Denis Noel M. U. tiene 40 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Don Denis se dedica a la actividad económica de la venta de mercadería en general como camisetas, ropa interior, calcetines, camisolas y otros. Hace mas de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad económica ya que anteriormente trabaja en una empresa de obrero pero debido a la situación fue despedido por lo que decide sobrevivir con el negocio de la venta de ropa por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes le realizan los pedidos al crédito. Los propósitos de Don Denis son de ampliar su negocio ya que el recorre las diferentes calles para ofrecer sus productos. Es por eso que recurre a los financiamientos previstos para capital de trabajo. Los sueños que Don Denis son de tener un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes una variedad de mercadería. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis Noel M. U. is 40 years old, and single. He sells clothing, such t-shirts, underwear, socks, and camisoles, among other items. He has been doing this for more than three years. Before, he worked as a laborer, but thanks to a rough economic situation was laid off. This is why he decided to survive by selling clothing, and the majority of his clients buy on credit.

Mr. Denis's goals are to grow his business, since he is now going street to street selling his wares. For this reason, he is asking for a loan for working capital. Mr. Denis dreams of having a stable place to offer a variety of products to his customers. He is asking for $6,000 córdobas (about $300 US).

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Chính 30 tuổi đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại  xã Nghi Hoa  huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005 và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá.  Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện nay thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và buôn bán hàng tạp hoá của gia đình chị đạt 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư  kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C., 30 years old, lives with her husband and two small children in Nghi Hoa commune, Nghi Loc district, Nghe An province. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2005 and borrowed money to invest in a general store. In addition, her family also raises livestock to earn extra income. Currently, her family’s income from livestock raising and the general store reaches VND2,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to invest more in the general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest more in the general store

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Эшматов Одилчон- мужчина 30 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Одилчон занимается. Одилчон после того как  приехал из заработок, с Российский Федерации в майе 2008 года занялся  откормом и продажей мелко рогатого кота. Одилчон имеет достаточный опыт в этой сфере. На полученный займ хочет купит  корм для своих овец. Таким образом, Одилчон ведет свои хозяйства и кормит свою семью. Ему также помогает сын и жена. Жена Одилчона  Гульмира имеет опыт работы в сфере откорма скота
texts.en:
Odiljob E. is thirty years old, married, and has one child. Since he returned in May 2008 from working in Russia he has been raising and selling small livestock, an area in which he has experience. He would like to use a loan to buy feed for his sheep. This business allows him to take care of his property and feed his family. His wife and son also help him. Odiljon's wife Gulmira also has experience in raising livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Nidia Andrea

texts.es: La señora Nidia Andrea S. tiene 50 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad, que cursa la secundaria. Su negocio es una librería que administra desde hace cinco años, la cual inicio con ahorros y luego con prestamos para reforzar el inventario. Este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de cuadernos, libros, bolsos, útiles para escolares entre otros. Con esto espera mejorar las ventas y captar clientes, da las gracias a la institución por los logros obtenidos. Sus planes a futuro es poder dar los estudios a su hija para que sea una profesional, a si como hacer más grande el local de la librería.
texts.en:
Nidia Andrea S. is 50 years old. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the city of Managua. She has one daughter who is 18 years old and in high school. Her business is a bookstore that she has been running for five years. She started it with savings and then obtained loans to increase her inventory. This is her fourth loan with Afrodenic, which she will use to purchase notebooks, books, bags, and school supplies, among other things. With this purchase she hopes to improve her sales and gain customers. She thanks the institution for the success she has experienced so far. Her future plans are to pay for her daughter's education, so she can have a profession, and to expand her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, books, bags to offer to customers

loans.name: Erling José

texts.es:
El señor Erling M. se dedica desde hace 5 años a la actividad de crianza de pollos en su municipio de Nagarote donde a diario da lugar a la crianza de estos animales porque es el negocio por el cual percibe utilidades para su familia.

A diario, Erling da de comer a los pollos y también cuida por su salud ya que estos a medida que van creciendo, los va vendiendo o procede a comercializarlos. Hoy en día él espera en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de los pollos, alimentación y desparasitación y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo para desarrollarlo.
texts.en:
Erling M. has been raising chicken for the past 5 years in the municipality of Nagarote. Every day he cares for his livestock because his business provides his family with what they need.

Every day Erling feeds his chicken but he also watches over their health. As they mature he sells them to the markets. He hopes that he will be given a loan by Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) so purchase more chicks, food, and medication. He needs this support now more than ever to pull through with his business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks and medication.

loans.name: Rita Marina

texts.en: Mrs. Rita G. lives with Mr. Emmanuel Aguayo.  They are both excellent, hard-working people, who have opened up an internet café in their neighborhood. The café has eight computers set up for clients. They are trying to develop their business by buying more computers in order to satisfy the demand of their clients. Rita began working with three computers and is expanding her business to an excellent level.

loans.use: The purchase of computers.

loans.name: Martha Consuelo

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Martha es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Martha vende productos naturales por medio de catálogos. Además Martha tiene una empresa de confecciones de polos, gorros, su taller se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Martha son tener una fabrica.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of “Nueva Vida” Community Bank. She is 40 years old and a single mother who has one daughter. She sells natural products through catalogs and owns a clothing business where she makes t-shirts and hats, at her studio in the city of Lima. Martha is asking for a loan of $300 which will be invested in the purchase of fabrics. Martha's dream is to have a factory

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
Neri es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Neri es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Neri tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad en donde vende pescado, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Neri en sus tiempos libres realiza el servicio de llamadas telefónicas.
Neri necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Neri sueña con ser mayorista, tener una cámara frigorífica.
texts.en:
Neri is a member of the Huamanga Morenita Communal Bank. Neri has a domestic partner. She is 27 years old and has three children. Neri has a job in the supply market of the city. They sell fish at this market. She sells fish everyday. In her free time, Niri has a telephone call service. Neri needs a loan for 800 soles. She will use this money to buy fish. Neri dreams of becoming a wholesaler and of having a walk-in refridgerator

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish
